0.title: Building undergoing repairs collapses in Delhi; 5 labourers feared trapped
0.article_body: At least five labourers are feared trapped under the debris of a building that collapsed in Delhi's Satya Niketan on Monday, fire officials said, adding that efforts are being made to rescue them. The building was undergoing repair work at the time of the incident. Six fire tenders have reached the spot to carry out the rescue operation, officials added.

1.title: World's oldest living person, Japan's Kane Tanaka, passes away at 119
1.article_body: Japan's Kane Tanaka, who was declared the world's oldest living person by the Guinness World Records, passed away on April 19, 2022, aged 119. The news was confirmed by Senior Gerontology Consultant Robert Young, who also helped confirm Kane's record as the oldest person living and oldest person living (female) in 2019. Tanaka had recently been hospitalised and discharged repeatedly.

2.title: Airline ordered to pay ₹8,000 to man for broken wheel of bag at Bengaluru airport
2.article_body: A man in Bengaluru has won compensation of ₹8,000 from an airline after a wheel of his checked-in trolley bag broke. The incident happened in 2017. The judges hearing the case reportedly reprimanded the airline for service deficiency and ordered that the customer be paid ₹5,000 as compensation for the luggage and ₹3,000 for his court expenses within 45 days.

3.title: Sara Ali Khan to star in a film on 1942 Quit India Movement: Report
3.article_body: Sara Ali Khan has reportedly signed on to star in a film based on 1942 Quit India Movement. As per Pinkvilla, she'll play the lead role in the project which will be helmed by 'Ek Thi Daayan' director Kannan Iyer. The report stated that it'll be released on a digital platform and will be backed by Karan Johar's Dharmatic Entertainment.

4.title: India's Deepak wins 2nd straight silver at Asian Wrestling Championships
4.article_body: Indian wrestler Deepak Punia won a silver medal after losing to Kazakhstan's Azmat Dauletbekov 1-6 in 86kg weight category on the concluding day of Asian Championships 2022 in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, on Sunday. It was Deepak's fourth medal in the tournament, having won a silver (2021) and two bronze (2019, 2020) before. Overall, India finished its campaign with 17 medals.

5.title: Punjab will recreate Delhi's education model: CM Bhagwant Mann
5.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Monday said the state will recreate Delhi's education model where students from all economic backgrounds will have equal right to get quality education. "The revolution in education system is discussed across the country. We will replicate the same model in Punjab...The country will progress this way by learning from each other," Mann added.

6.title: All the people living in Hindustan are Indians, and are Hindu: BJP MP
6.article_body: Mansukh Vasava, Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MP from Bharuch Lok Sabha constituency, said that all people living in Hindustan are Indians and Hindus. "If all become Muslim or Buddhist or Christian then what will happen to Hindus in Hindustan? Have you ever imagined that? I'm not custodian of Hindu religion...Hindu religion is prevailing in entire Hindustan," he added.

7.title: Former Union Home Secy Madhav Godbole passes away at 85 in Pune
7.article_body: Former Union Home Secretary and IAS officer Madhav Godbole (85) passed away at his residence in Pune due to a cardiac failure on Monday, his family said. Godbole held several positions before retiring in 1993 including the Secretary of the Department of Justice. He held a PhD in economics from Mumbai University and an MA from Williams College, Massachusetts.

8.title: Didn't expect something like this: Verstappen after Imola GP win
8.article_body: Following a win at the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix at Imola, Red Bull driver Max Verstappen has said, "Coming into...weekend I didn't expect something like this but as a team...we executed everything very well." "That's always...hard to do at such an intense weekend with the sprint qualifying as well," he added. This is Verstappen's second Grand Prix win this season.

9.title: Barça are still in top 4 but we've made our lives complicated: Xavi
9.article_body: Speaking after a 0-1 defeat against Rayo Vallecano in La Liga, Barcelona head coach Xavi Hernández has said that his team is in a "tough situation". "We are still in the top four but we have made our lives complicated," Xavi stated. Barcelona are placed second on the La Liga points table with 63 points from 33 matches.

10.title: B'luru garbage trucks to have speed regulators to avoid accidents
10.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will install speed regulators on 588 of its garbage compactors to restrict their speed to 35 km per hour. This comes after a two-wheeler rider was killed by a speeding city garbage truck recently. "To avoid similar mishaps in the future, we'll be providing basic skill development training to drivers," an official said.

11.title: Lata Didi said 'won't do it even for 10cr dollars': Asha on singing at weddings
11.article_body: Veteran singer Asha Bhosle has revealed that her late sister and legendary singer Lata Mangeshkar once turned down an invite to sing at a wedding for 'millions' in compensation, saying, "We do not sing at weddings." Bhosle revealed, "They said they wanted Asha Bhosle and Lata Mangeshkar...[Didi]...told the rep, 'We will not sing even if you offer 10 crore dollars'."

12.title: 66-year-old ex-India cricketer Arun Lal to marry 38-year-old teacher Bul Bul Saha
12.article_body: Former India cricketer Arun Lal will tie the knot with 38-year-old Bul Bul Saha on May 2 in Kolkata. The 66-year-old has reportedly taken consent from his first wife Rina Devi, who is ailing. Arun and Rina have divorced, but they still live together due to her illness. Bul Bul is a school teacher by profession.

13.title: Priest arrested for denying Dalit couple entry into Rajasthan temple
13.article_body: A priest has been arrested for allegedly not allowing a Dalit couple to offer prayers at a temple in Rajasthan's Jalore, police said. In a video footage, the priest is purportedly seen stopping the couple at the temple gate and getting into an argument with them. Rajasthan minister Mahesh Joshi condemned the incident and said all religions are equal.

14.title: I'm upset with party's leadership in Gujarat: Cong's Hardik Patel
14.article_body: Gujarat Congress Working President Hardik Patel on Monday said he isn't upset with Congress leaders Rahul or Priyanka Gandhi but with the party's state leadership. "Elections are coming up...Work should be done together with honest and strong people. They should be given positions," Patel said. He had earlier said his position in Congress is like a groom forced into 'nasbandi'.

15.title: Navneet Rana alleges 'casteist abuse' in jail, says 'not allowed to drink water'
15.article_body: The MP from Maharashtra's Amravati Navneet Rana has alleged she was denied "basic human rights" and "abused in the most filthy language" over her caste in jail. Rana, writing to Lok Sabha Speaker, said she was denied drinking water only because of her caste. "I was told...'we don't let people from 'neechi zaat' Scheduled Castes use our bathrooms'," she alleged.

16.title: HC grants protection to interfaith MP couple who eloped and got married
16.article_body: Nearly 20 days after an interfaith couple from Madhya Pradesh eloped and got married in a temple in Chhattisgarh, MP High Court's Jabalpur bench restrained police from taking action against the man in a kidnapping case lodged by the woman's family. This comes after the Dindori administration demolished three shops and house belonging to the man's family, citing "illegal construction".

17.title: Didn't want to give her a small role: Director on cutting Kajal's role in Acharya
17.article_body: Director Koratala Siva spoke about cutting Kajal Aggarwal's role in 'Acharya'. He said it was inappropriate to cast the actress in a role with no clear ending. "Initally, Kajal's role was designed as a funny role, but after viewing the rushes, I thought it wasn't right to place a star actress in such a small-length role," he added.

18.title: Don't believe in too many changes in the playing XI: Rohit Sharma
18.article_body: On being asked about the Singaporean batter Tim David not featuring in the playing XI, Mumbai Indians skipper Rohit Sharma said that he doesn't believe in "too many changes". "We want to make sure whoever gets a chance...gets a run in the XI. So we try not to make too many changes...That's how I look at it," Sharma said.

19.title: KTR inaugurates Ferring pharmaceutical facility in Hyderabad
19.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao inaugurated the Ferring Pharmaceuticals' laboratories plant at Genome Valley in Hyderabad on Monday. The Swiss pharmaceutical company's facility has been established with an investment of an estimated €30 million (over ₹240 crore) and will reportedly provide employment to over 100 people. The company caters to reproductive medicine and maternal health products.

20.title: Heroin worth ₹280 cr seized from Pak boat off Guj coast; 9 held
20.article_body: A joint team of the Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad and Indian Coast Guard apprehended nine Pakistani nationals off Gujarat's Jakhau coast and seized over 50 kg of heroin worth ₹280 crore, police said. The accused used a boat named Al Haj to bring in the drugs at the behest of a Pakistani smuggler, said the Director-General of Gujarat Police Ashish Bhatia.

21.title: US oil falls below $100 mark as China lockdowns stoke demand fears
21.article_body: Oil price fell below the $100 mark again on Monday as prolonged COVID-19 lockdowns in China stoked fears regarding waning demand for oil. While US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell $4.11 to $97.96/barrel, Brent crude fell $4.63 to $102.02/barrel. Oil prices also likely weakened on the prospect of higher interest rates in the US, which is boosting the US dollar.

22.title: Who are now the world's 10 richest people as Adani becomes 5th richest?
22.article_body: Gautam Adani overtook Berkshire Hathaway's Warren Buffett to become the world's 5th-richest person with $123.7 billion wealth, Forbes said. Elon Musk is the richest worldwide with $269.7 billion in wealth, followed by Jeff Bezos, LVMH's Bernard Arnault & family and Bill Gates. Buffett is 6th-richest, followed by Larry Ellison, Google Co-founder Larry Page, Mukesh Ambani and Google's Sergey Brin.

23.title: Health Ministry organises awareness activities across India on World Malaria Day
23.article_body: The Union Health Ministry organised various awareness activities across India on Monday  on World Malaria Day. Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya also called for prioritisation of malaria elimination through national and sub-national efforts. "Our efforts have resulted in 86.45% decline in malaria cases and 79.16% reduction in malaria related deaths in 2021 as compared to 2015," Mandaviya said.

24.title: World no. 8 Rublev beats Djokovic to win 3rd title of 2022 at Serbia Open
24.article_body: World number eight Andrey Rublev defeated world number one Novak Djokovic 6-2, 6-7(4-7), 6-0 at Serbia Open to win his third title of the season on Sunday. With this, the Russian has now equalled Rafael Nadal's mark of most titles in 2022. Meanwhile, women's world number one Iga Swiatek won Stuttgart Open for her fourth straight title of the season.

25.title: Jasprit Bumrah has less threatening performances than Shaheen: Aqib
25.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Aqib Javed has said that Shaheen Shah Afridi's graph as a pacer is on the rise, whereas, Jasprit Bumrah's graph is stable. "Bumrah's isn't that aggressive...He has less threatening performances than Shaheen, whether it's in T20Is, ODIs or...Tests," Aqib stated. Shaheen has taken 201 wickets in 94 international games. Bumrah has 303 wickets in 156 international games.

26.title: Minor girl gang-raped in Jharkhand’s Ranchi; 3 arrested
26.article_body: Three persons were arrested for allegedly raping a minor girl in Jharkhand's Ranchi, police said on Monday. "Gang-rape with a minor was reported in Chanho police station area of rural Ranchi last evening," said police. "All accused are known to the victim. They called her to meet, then took her to a secluded place and raped her," added police.

27.title: Anushka shares video from her training for 'Chakda 'Xpress', Jhulan reacts
27.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to share a video showing how she's preparing for 'Chakda 'Xpress', an upcoming film based on the life of Indian cricketer Jhulan Goswami. "That's how the last few days have been," she captioned the video where she's seen practising on a field. Jhulan reacted to Anushka's post and dropped a few clapping hands emojis.

28.title: Confident about Asian Games to be held in September: OCA official
28.article_body: The Olympic Council of Asia (OCA) remains confident about the Asian Games to go ahead in Hangzhou in September, a senior official told Reuters. "The OCA has written to Beijing to get more clarity on the situation...The matter will be taken up for discussion at the OCA executive board meeting in Tashkent on May 6," the official said.

29.title: Villagers attack police team in MP, free illegal liquor case accused from custody
29.article_body: A group of villagers allegedly attacked 12 police personnel with sticks and stones and freed an illegal liquor trade case accused from their custody in Madhya Pradesh's Tikamgarh district. Five police personnel sustained injuries in the incident and windowpanes of two police vehicles were also damaged, an officer said. A case has been registered against 20 persons, including women.

30.title: Akshay Kumar asks fans to suggest title for 'Soorarai Pottru' remake
30.article_body: Akshay Kumar on Monday asked fans to suggest a title for his Hindi remake of Suriya's 2020 Tamil film 'Soorarai Pottru' on social media. The untitled film, which co-stars Radhika Madan, is inspired by the life of Air Deccan founder Captain GR Gopinath and is directed by Sudha Kongara. Fans suggested titles like 'Ucchai', 'Uchayee' and 'Udaan' among others.

31.title: Bitcoin falls to six-week low, Ether declines nearly 5%
31.article_body: Bitcoin fell as much as 3.2% to $38,236 on Monday, marking the crypto's lowest level since March 15. The world's largest cryptocurrency extended this month's losses as investors shied away from risk assets amid a more hawkish outlook for US Federal Reserve policy tightening. Ether, the second-biggest crypto, also slumped 4.8% to $2,799, a level not seen since March 18.

32.title: Casey Affleck joins cast of Christopher Nolan's 'Oppenheimer'
32.article_body: Casey Affleck has joined the cast of Christopher Nolan's next film 'Oppenheimer'. A few pictures of the actor from the sets of the film have surfaced online. 'Oppenheimer' also stars Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr and Emily Blunt. The film, which is based on the life of American physicist J Robert Oppenheimer, is expected to release on July 21, 2023.

33.title: Apple's crypto rules raise potential antitrust issues: Coinbase CEO
33.article_body: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said Apple has banned a "bunch of features" on its mobile application which creates room for "potential antitrust issues". "Apple so far has not really played nice with crypto," Armstrong said. He added that he believes crypto-compatible phones could be "quite popular" in the future and that smartphone makers should start preparing crypto-specific hardware features.

34.title: Pune entrepreneur wins US award for giving clean potable water solutions
34.article_body: A Pune-based entrepreneur, Rahul Pathak, has won a gold prize at the Edison Awards ceremony in the United States. He won the award for his innovative solution of making clean potable water available quickly at affordable prices for people facing natural calamities. He said, "We are planning to reach the most vulnerable population who are affected by disasters."

35.title: Claims tribunal members to visit violence-hit Khargone on April 26
35.article_body: Two members of a claims tribunal formed by the Madhya Pradesh government will visit violence-hit Khargone to assess damages on April 26. Several properties were damaged when communal clashes broke out after a Ram Navami procession was disrupted in the city. The state government conducted a demolition drive to raze illegal properties following the violence.

36.title: Adani Power sixth Adani group firm to hit ₹1 lakh cr m-cap
36.article_body: Adani Power became the sixth Adani Group firm to cross ₹1 lakh-crore market valuation after its shares hit an all-time high of ₹272 apiece on Monday. The stock has risen over 100% in a month and about 290% since hitting a 52-week low of ₹69.95 in August 2021. Earlier, Adani Green Energy and Adani Transmission, among others, hit this milestone.

37.title: BTS' Jimin's home seized over unpaid health insurance, released later
37.article_body: South Korean band BTS member Jimin's Seoul apartment was seized by National Health Insurance Service over non-payment of his health insurance premiums. The apartment was reportedly seized in January and released on April 22 after the premiums were paid. BTS' agency Big Hit released a statement apologising for the negligence saying that a portion of Jimin's mail had been omitted.

38.title: Amid temperature rise, Bihar temple installs fans, ACs for deities
38.article_body: A Bihar temple has installed fans and air conditioners to protect deities from heat, amid the rising temperature in several parts of north India. "With the help of fans, coolers and ACs, common people are protecting themselves from the heat...thinking on the same lines...we have installed same for Gods and Goddesses here," President of ISKCON temple, Gaya, said.

39.title: KL Rahul has matured way beyond his age: Kevin Pietersen
39.article_body: Ex-England skipper Kevin Pietersen called LSG captain KL Rahul a dynamic player, who has matured way beyond his age. Pietersen added, "To continue scoring runs for different franchises is a damn hard (thing)...there's so much pressure...when you get bought for such big money." The 30-year-old is currently the second-highest scorer in IPL 2022, with 368 runs in eight games.

40.title: 'KGF' director, producer kiss Yash after film's success, picture surfaces
40.article_body: After success of 'KGF: Chapter 2', the distributor of the film, Hombale Films, shared a picture where film's director Prashanth Neel and producer Vijay Kiragandur can be seen kissing actor Yash on the cheeks. "It's just the beginning," Hombale Films wrote. Fans took to the comments section to share old pictures of the trio in the same pose.

41.title: SBI employee cheats 75-yr-old woman of ₹45 lakh in Hyd, arrested
41.article_body: A State Bank of India (SBI) employee was arrested by Hyderabad Police on Friday for allegedly cheating a 75-year-old woman of ₹45 lakh. The accused had promised to help victim download mobile banking app and then gained access to her account by replacing her registered phone number with his number. Accused availed overdrafts on victim's fixed deposits of ₹45 lakh.

42.title: India a technological powerhouse: EU chief on launching trade, tech body with India
42.article_body: India and the European Union (EU) on Monday launched the India-EU Trade and Technology Council to tackle challenges in trade, trusted technology and security. "We have India as a technological powerhouse," said EU chief Ursula von der Leyen while holding talks with PM Narendra Modi in Delhi. Till now, EU only had one such council in place with the US.

43.title: People said 'This is why you are gay': Saisha on being sexually assaulted as a child
43.article_body: Talking about being sexually assaulted as a child, designer Saisha Shinde said, "The few people whom I told about it, they said to me 'This is why you are so much into sex, this is why you are gay'." "I never gathered the courage to talk about it after that," Saisha added on 'Lock Upp'.

44.title: Prasoon Joshi's mother Sushma Joshi passes away
44.article_body: Lyricist and Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) chief Prasoon Joshi's mother Sushma Joshi passed away on Sunday. Sushma had worked with All India Radio for over three decades. She was also a lecturer of political science and a classical singer. Her last rites were held at Ram Bagh Shamshan Bhumi in Gurugram.

45.title: MP Navneet Rana being mistreated at Mumbai's Byculla jail: Fadnavis
45.article_body: Maharashtra BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis alleged MP Navneet Rana was being mistreated at Byculla jail, not given drinking water and wasn't allowed to go to washroom in night. "The whole government machinery is scared of one woman," Fadnavis said. Navneet and her MLA husband were arrested after they gave a call for chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside CM Uddhav Thackeray's home.

46.title: Don't get involved in civil disputes: Owaisi to party workers
46.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has asked his party workers not to get involved in civil disputes, especially after an AIMIM corporator Nazir Ahmed Honyal was arrested in the Hubballi stone-pelting incident in Karnataka. "I have come here to advise you all to not interfere in any kind of land or construction issues...Let the law take its own course," Owaisi said.

47.title: Swiggy programme to let delivery partners get managerial-level jobs
47.article_body: Swiggy has launched an accelerator programme called 'Step Ahead' to help its delivery partners get managerial-level jobs with a fixed salary and become full-time Swiggy employees. Swiggy intends to reserve at least 20% of fleet manager hires for its delivery executives. A Swiggy delivery executive "must hold a college degree, possess communication skills and basic computer knowledge" for the role.

48.title: India's military spending 3rd highest in the world at $76.6 billion: Report
48.article_body: India's military spending in 2021 was the third highest in the world at $76.6 billion, according to the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI). The five largest spenders in 2021 were the United States, China, India, the United Kingdom and Russia. US military spending reached $801 billion in 2021, while China spent $293 billion on defence.

49.title: Comedienne Bharti Singh shares first picture of her baby boy
49.article_body: Comedienne Bharti Singh on Sunday shared the first picture of her baby boy on Instagram, writing, "Life line." Bharti and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa welcomed their son earlier this month. She resumed working 12 days after giving birth and was criticised for leaving her child at home. Bharti had responded saying there are some work commitments that cannot be ignored.

50.title: Cyient to buy Finland's Citec for €94 mn in its largest-ever acquisition
50.article_body: Hyderabad-based engineering and technology solutions provider Cyient announced on Monday it has signed definitive agreements to acquire Finland-based Citec, in its largest acquisition to date. Cyient will acquire the plant and product engineering services company for €94 million in an all-cash deal. It will be the largest outbound acquisition by an Indian engineering services company, Cyient said.

51.title: I will be finished the day I start taking audience for granted: Nawazuddin
51.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said reinventing as a performer is the only way to not become "jaded" in the film industry. "The day I stop the process thinking that the audience will love me anyway as I am a great actor, my downfall will begin," he added. "If I take that love, the audience for granted, I am finished," Nawazuddin said.

52.title: Billie Eilish trips during Coachella performance; jokes 'I just ate s***, ouch!'
52.article_body: Billie Eilish fell over on her face during her Coachella 2022 performance. She tripped on stage right after the stage lights dimmed as the singer was getting ready to perform her song 'Getting Older'. After tripping, the singer gathered herself and joked with the crowd saying, "I just ate s**t! Ouch...I'm good. It was dark!"

53.title: Provide relief to farmers, don't make false promises: Punjab Cong chief to Kejriwal
53.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja on Sunday asked AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal to provide relief to the farmers instead of making "fake" and "false" claims and promises. "Nobody stops you and your party’s government in Punjab from providing relief to farmers which you promised, why are you not doing that?" Raja added.

54.title: Medical college in Haryana village to be named after Guru Tegh Bahadur: CM
54.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said that a government medical college being built in Haryana's Panjupur village, Yamunanagar district will be named after Guru Tegh Bahadur. The foundation of the college will be laid within three months. Khattar made the announcement while addressing an event organised in Panipat to mark the 400th birth anniversary of Guru Tegh Bahadur.

55.title: Tap water to homes in Bundelkhand-Varanasi by 2024 is govt's priority: UP minister
55.article_body: UP Jal Shakti Minister Swatantra Dev Singh said it is the government's priority to ensure the supply of clean drinking tap water to the homes of the poor living in villages from Bundelkhand to Varanasi (Kashi) by 2024. The government is working continuously to provide pure tap water to the people in the last line of the society, Singh added.

56.title: J'khand schools told to suspend morning assembly, sports amid COVID-19 surge
56.article_body: The Jharkhand School Education and Literacy Department has asked schools to suspend morning assembly, cultural programmes and sports activities amid rising COVID-19 cases in some states. The schools have been asked to conduct regular health check-ups in coordination with nearest health centres and district administrations have been directed to ensure random COVID-19 tests of students and teachers.

57.title: Female tiger cub found dead in MP's Bandhavgarh Reserve
57.article_body: A female tiger cub was found dead in Madhya Pradesh's Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve (BTR) on Sunday. According to BTR's field director BS Annigeri, the 7-8-month-old cub's carcass showed serious injury marks on the head, stomach, back and ears, in the Dhamokhar buffer zone. It is suspected that the cub was killed in an attack by a male tiger, official said.

58.title: Hindutva is culture, not chaos: Shiv Sena on Hanuman Chalisa issue
58.article_body: Hindutva is a culture and not chaos, Shiv Sena said in an editorial in its mouthpiece, Saamana, on Monday. The statement comes amid the ongoing Hanuman Chalisa issue in the state. "The ruckus that the Bharatiya Janata Party has started in the name of Hindutva at the moment cannot be supported," Shiv Sena said.

59.title: Adani overtakes Buffett to become world's 5th richest person: Forbes
59.article_body: Adani Group's 59-year-old Chairman Gautam Adani has overtaken Berkshire Hathaway's 91-year-old CEO Warren Buffett to become the world's fifth-richest person with a net worth of over $123.7 billion as of Friday's close, Forbes said. Adani's net worth stood at $8.9 billion just two years ago, Forbes added. Shares of Adani's businesses are up by between 19% to 195% this year.

60.title: Inzamam-ul-Haq's only Test hit-wicket dismissal came off Monty Panesar
60.article_body: England's Monty Panesar, who turns 40 today, is the only bowler to get ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq out hit-wicket in Test cricket. Trying to sweep Panesar during a Test in 2006, Inzamam lost balance and hit the stumps while attempting to jump over them. Panesar represented England in 50 Tests, with his maiden wicket being that of Sachin Tendulkar.

61.title: 'Extras' joint top-scored in ODI cricket's lowest-ever total
61.article_body: On April 25, 2004, Zimbabwe were dismissed for the lowest-ever ODI total of 35 in 18 overs against Sri Lanka. As many as four Zimbabwe batters got out for ducks while Dion Ebrahim top-scored with 7, same as the number of extras conceded by Sri Lankan bowlers. Sri Lanka won the match by 9 wickets, with 244 balls remaining.

62.title: Vehicle license number 'AA8' sold for ₹73 crore in Dubai
62.article_body: A unique license plate number has been sold for around ₹73 crore (35 million Dirhams) at a charity auction in Dubai. The number is reportedly the third most expensive license plate number in the world. License plate numbers 'F55' and 'V66' were also sold at the auction for four million Dirhams (approximately ₹8.34 crore) each.

63.title: Empty train damages platform after derailing at station in Chennai, pic surfaces
63.article_body: A train climbed the platform after derailing at the Beach station in Chennai on Sunday. The empty Electric Multiple Unit (EMU) was being moved from the yard to platform when the incident happened. The driver jumped out of the train and is undergoing treatment at a hospital, an official said. No case has been registered against him, the official added.

64.title: Akshay, Radhika Madan begin shooting for 'Soorarai Pottru' remake
64.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Radhika Madan have started shooting for the Hindi remake of Suriya-starrer film 'Soorarai Pottru'. Akshay took to his social media handles on Monday to share a video showing him and the actress beginning the filming with a coconut-breaking ritual. The yet-untitled remake will be directed by Sudha Kongara, who also helmed the original film.

65.title: CM Bommai should be held responsible: DK Shivakumar on PSI scam
65.article_body: Amid the controversies surrounding the police sub-inspector (PSI) recruitment scam in Karnataka, Congress state President DK Shivakumar has criticised the CM Basavaraj Bommai-led state government. "Why did the CM say in the assembly that no mistakes happened in PSI recruitment? He should also be held responsible for lies. Why did he give the case to CID now?" Shivakumar asked.

66.title: Mumbai man held for circulating woman's pvt pics on Insta, blackmailing her
66.article_body: A 21-year-old man from Mumbai allegedly circulated private photos of a 19-year-old woman on Instagram and further blackmailed her in order for her to share her intimate photos with him. Police, with the help of Instagram, tracked down the accused and arrested him. "Any woman who is being threatened in such a manner must approach local police," an officer said.

67.title: NCP leader seeks permission to chant religious prayers at PM's house
67.article_body: NCP leader Fahmida Khan wrote a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday seeking permission to chant prayers of all religions, including namaz, Hanuman Chalisa, Namokar Mantra and Guru Granth Sahib, outside PM Narendra Modi's residence in Delhi. "If Hindutva, Jainism...[can help] the country...reduce inflation, unemployment [and] starvation, I would like to do it," she said.

68.title: 35-yr-old woman stripped and assaulted publicly on camera in Karnataka; 9 booked
68.article_body: A 35-year-old tribal woman was allegedly stripped and assaulted by a group of people in Dakshina Kannada district of Karnataka. The incident took place over a land dispute on April 19 and came to light when a video showing the mob stripping the woman as dozens looked on went viral. Police have booked nine persons in the case.

69.title: Tom Cruise's 'The Mummy' is probably the biggest failure of my life: Maker Alex
69.article_body: Alex Kurtzman, who helmed the action-adventure film 'The Mummy', has said the Tom Cruise-starrer film is "probably the biggest failure" of his life, "both personally and professionally". "There's about a million things I regret about it, but it also gave me...many gifts that are inexpressibly beautiful," he added. The film, which was released in 2017, also featured Russell Crowe.

70.title: TN passes Bill to acquire Guv's power to appoint vice-chancellors to universities
70.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Monday passed a Bill seeking to take over the Governor's power to appoint vice-chancellors to universities. CM MK Stalin said the state government's lack of power to appoint vice-chancellors impacts higher education in the state. "Even in...Gujarat, one of the three candidates recommended by state government's search committee is appointed vice-chancellor," he added.

71.title: Need to have a chat with other coaches: Jayawardena on MI's batting
71.article_body: After their eighth straight defeat in IPL 2022, MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena said he needs to have a chat with the other coaches to review their performance. "Batting has been a problem area. We have batted under par," Jayawardena added. "We've not hit our straps...we're [also] not taking early wickets...batsmen are scoring centuries against us," he further said.

72.title: Lata Mangeshkar’s brother Hridaynath admitted to hospital, son says he's 'stable'
72.article_body: Late singer Lata Mangeshkar's brother Hridaynath Mangeshkar has been admitted to a hospital, his son, singer Adinath Mangeshkar confirmed on Sunday. Adinath added that the doctors have said that Hridaynath is getting better and will get discharged from the hospital in 10 days. "By the grace of God, he will be back home...He is stable and doing well," Adinath said.

73.title: It was over the top: Parthiv on Krunal's reaction after taking Pollard's wicket
73.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel has criticised LSG all-rounder Krunal Pandya for the send-off he gave to MI's Kieron Pollard after dismissing him in their match on Sunday. "It's important to give people space...In the dressing room, you can have as much banter as you want...But, this reaction was over the top," stated Parthiv. Krunal kissed Pollard after taking his wicket.

74.title: Dogs found feeding on corpse of woman missing for 6 days in Punjab
74.article_body: A group of dogs was found feeding on the corpse of a woman who had been missing for the last six days in Punjab's Ludhiana. The police have only found skeletal remains of the deceased woman, Guddi Devi. Her daughter identified her with the help of a necklace. Police said that they are waiting for a postmortem report.

75.title: Global military spending hits record high, passes $2 trillion in 2021: Report
75.article_body: The global military spending hit a record high in 2021, crossing $2 trillion for the first time. It reached $2.113 trillion, 12% higher than in 2012, according to a report by Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI). "Even amid the economic fallout of the COVID-19 pandemic, world military spending hit record levels," said a researcher at SIPRI.

76.title: Panic buying in Beijing amid fears of Shanghai-like lockdown
76.article_body: The Chinese reportedly resorted to panic buying, stocking up food and supplies, in Beijing amid fears of a Shanghai-like lockdown after the authorities ordered mass testing in the Chaoyang district. The residents of Chaoyang have been asked to get tested for COVID-19 three times this week. This comes after the district reported several COVID-19 cases.

77.title: Not going to be easy: Manjrekar on Karthik's T20 WC chances
77.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has said it's not going to be easy for RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik to get into India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "When you say we want DK in team, you want a guy out...We'll have to start looking at Hardik Pandya vs Karthik. It's not going to be easy," he explained.

78.title: 2 robbers snatch man's debit card outside Pune ATM, steal ₹2 lakh
78.article_body: Two unidentified robbers allegedly snatched the debit card of a man who was coming out of an ATM in Pune's Dehu on Sunday and stole ₹2 lakh by making multiple transactions, police said. According to the police, one of the accused asked the man to show his debit card and when he refused, the duo snatched it and ran away.

79.title: Very definition of luck deserting you: Harsha Bhogle on Kishan's 'unusual' dismissal
79.article_body: Referring to MI opener Ishan Kishan's dismissal against LSG, Harsha Bhogle said, "If you want to know the very definition of luck deserting you, you just saw the entire novel, the entire screenplay." Kishan got caught out in slips after the ball bounced off wicketkeeper Quinton De Kock's shoe. Meanwhile, Nick Knight said, "You would not believe it."

80.title: 5 including 4 Indian tourists killed in car-bus collision in Nepal
80.article_body: Four Indian tourists were among five persons who were killed after their car collided with a bus in Nepal's Dhading district, police said. The four Indian nationals were returning to Kathmandu after visiting Pokhara when the accident took place. The Nepalese driver of the car was also killed in the accident.

81.title: Man kills brother after developing feelings for sister-in-law in UP: Police
81.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police arrested a man for killing his brother after he allegedly developed feelings for his sister-in-law. The man, Bhupendra Sahu, lived with his brother, Mohit, and sister-in-law in Lucknow. "Bhupendra...started making advances towards her. Mohit's wife...complained...to her husband...brothers had argument over this and Bhupendra overpowered Mohit and slit his throat," police said.

82.title: 3 critically endangered Sumatran tigers found dead in Indonesia
82.article_body: Three critically endangered Sumatran tigers were found dead in Indonesia's Aceh, authorities said on Monday. The tigers, whose population has decreased to about 400, were found with injuries caused due to snare traps, an official said. Under Indonesian law, people who intentionally kill protected animals face up to five years of imprisonment and 100 million rupiah fine (about ₹5.3 lakh).

83.title: IPL share video of Ishan Kishan's wicket, say 'Most bizarre dismissal in IPL?'
83.article_body: The IPL have shared the video of Mumbai Indians (MI) opener Ishan Kishan's dismissal against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG), writing, "Most bizarre dismissal in IPL? Ishan’s unusual wicket." Kishan was dismissed on the bowling of Ravi Bishnoi after the ball bounced off the shoe of LSG wicketkeeper Quinton De Kock and was caught by Jason Holder in the slips.

84.title: Jamia shooter Rambhakt Gopal shares video of gun pointed at kids in Haryana
84.article_body: Rambhakt Gopal, the shooter who fired at an anti-CAA protest near Jamia Millia University in 2020, has shared a video showing a gun pointed out of an SUV at children and women in Haryana. Another video shows a group of men brandishing pistols and dragging a man into an SUV, with the caption "Taking away the cow smuggler" on Instagram.

85.title: Hunt on for 2 suspects in Nigeria oil blast; death toll rises to 110
85.article_body: A local oil official said on Sunday that the search for two suspects involved in the blast at an oil refining depot in Nigeria's Rivers has been intensified. This comes as a disaster management agency official told AFP that the death toll from the blast has risen to 110. The country's President had called it a "catastrophe and national disaster".

86.title: B'luru woman dies as husband physically assaults, locks her in bedroom
86.article_body: A 48-year-old woman died after her 55-year-old husband physically assaulted her in Bengaluru. Reports said that the husband also locked her in the bedroom for three hours after rendering her unconscious. Their son, who filed a complaint with the police, said his father even used a wooden stick to hit his mother.

87.title: Hated my Mumbai school, was bullied & teachers were not nice to me: Shahid
87.article_body: Shahid Kapoor in an interview spoke about his school life and revealed that he was bullied in his Mumbai school. "I hated my school in Mumbai...I was treated very badly and my teachers were also not very nice to me," he added. "I loved my...[Delhi] school, I was there from Jr KG and I'd a lot of friends," Shahid said.

88.title: Shiv Sena workers still giving threats: Somaiya over 'attack'
88.article_body: Following the alleged attack on BJP leader Kirit Somaiya, a BJP Mumbai unit delegation will meet the Union Home Secretary in New Delhi on Monday, the state BJP said. "We'll give a detailed report and demand a special team for inquiry," Somaiya said. "Fake FIR was registered against me. Shiv Sena workers are still giving threats," Somaiya stated.

89.title: 3 bike-borne persons loot ₹80,000 from money changer in Dhuri
89.article_body: Three bike-borne persons allegedly took away ₹80,000 and a mobile phone from a money changer at gunpoint in Punjab's Dhuri on Sunday afternoon. The victim was working at his shop when two persons entered inside and pointed a pistol at him while the third person remained seated on a motorcycle outside the shop, police said.

90.title: 168 killed, 98 hurt in tribal clashes in Sudan's Darfur: Aid group
90.article_body: At least 168 people were killed and 98 others were injured in tribal clashes between Arabs and non-Arabs in Sudan's Darfur region, the General Coordination for Refugees and Displaced in Darfur spokesperson Adam Regal said. He added that the clashes first began on Thursday with the killing of two people. Authorities have deployed troops in the area following the clashes.

91.title: Youth strangles pregnant girlfriend for pressuring him for marriage in Ghaziabad
91.article_body: A 19-year-old youth has been arrested for allegedly strangling his pregnant girlfriend to death with a dupatta in Ghaziabad. Police said that the accused, who was in a relationship with the girl for the past few months, was fed up with her constant appeals to get married. Police had to form several teams to arrest the man, who was absconding.

92.title: Police caught me by shoulder, almost pushed me into a warehouse: Pratik on VIP movement
92.article_body: Actor Pratik Gandhi described on Twitter how he felt "humiliated" by police's actions when he started walking on road to reach shoot location amid jam due to "VIP movement". Pratik revealed police caught him by shoulder and "almost" pushed him into a warehouse. After a Twitter user mentioned that PM Narendra Modi was in Mumbai, Pratik replied, "Oops...I didn't know."

93.title: Man stabbed to death by his 3 uncles on UP street as passersby watch, act caught on CCTV
93.article_body: A man, in his 20s, was stabbed to death by his three uncles in broad daylight on a street in UP's Meerut on Sunday afternoon. As per police, the uncles had an argument with the deceased, Sajjid, on Saturday and Sunday morning. Police have collected the CCTV footage of the murder and are investigating the matter.

94.title: J&K will soon set example of development for country: LG Manoj Sinha
94.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha on Sunday said it was a big day for the UT as PM Narendra Modi laid the foundation stones and inaugurated development works worth over ₹20,000 crore. J&K will soon set an example of development for the country, Sinha added. "Now, all laws have been implemented which are helping women and people of J&K," Sinha stated.

95.title: Photo of UP Crime Branch officer smoking hookah with top criminal goes viral
95.article_body: A photo of UP Crime Branch officer Mohammad Asif smoking hookah with a top criminal named Ankit Lala has surfaced on social media. After the photo of Asif sitting with Kanpur's Ankit Lala went viral, the officer was suspended and an enquiry was ordered, reported India Today. Samajwadi Party shared the news on Twitter and demanded action against the officer.

96.title: UP Police's sniffer dog passes away, given farewell with state honours
96.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police's sniffer dog, Vicon, passed away on Sunday due to prolonged illness. Vicon, who was born in 2011, was appointed as sniffer dog for the explosive section in the dog squad of Uttar Pradesh Police in 2012. Vicon was given a final farewell by salute with state honours by senior police officials.

97.title: I don't want to get ahead of myself: KL Rahul on 4th IPL hundred
97.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul, who slammed his fourth IPL hundred on Sunday, has said he doesn't want to get ahead of himself and is only playing according to the situation in the ongoing IPL season. "Enjoying batting, enjoying the responsibility. Fingers crossed I can keep doing the right things," he added. Rahul scored 103* off 62 balls against MI.

98.title: Attempts being made to divide Tamil Nadu on basis of caste & religion: Stalin
98.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Sunday said attempts are being made to divide the state on the basis of caste and religion. "Some people want to stop the development of the state by dividing us. The people of Tamil Nadu should realise this and act," Stalin added. "Only a peaceful country can achieve all kinds of development," Stalin stated.

99.title: 2 labourers injured in explosion at venue of event in J&K's Rajouri
99.article_body: Two persons were injured in an explosion that took place in Shahpur village of Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Sunday evening. Police said the two injured persons, both local labourers, have been shifted to a nearby hospital. The explosion took place when organisers at an event were packing things at the end of the occasion.

100.title: Maximum temperature in parts of Delhi may touch 45-46°C by April 28: IMD
100.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that the maximum temperature in some parts of Delhi could reach around 45-46°C on April 27 and 28. According to the IMD, there may be some relief from April 28 onwards due to the impact of a western disturbance expected across northwest India. Safdarjung recorded a maximum temperature of 39.5°C on Sunday.

101.title: US officials meet Ukraine Prez, announce military aid
101.article_body: A US delegation, including Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin, met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv. The US announced military aid worth $322 million and approved a $165 million sale of ammunition to Ukraine. The US said it will gradually restart embassy operations in Ukraine and the diplomats would return to the war-torn country.

102.title: Mahesh Babu's next with Rajamouli likely to go on floors in Dec: Report
102.article_body: Mahesh Babu's next film with filmmaker SS Rajamouli, tentatively titled 'SSMB29', is expected to go on floors in December this year, according to a report. The actor, who recently completed shooting for his upcoming action-drama 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata', has reportedly flown to Dubai where he'll discuss the script with Rajamouli. 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata' is slated to release on May 12.

103.title: 102 kg heroin worth ₹700 cr from Afghanistan seized at Attari
103.article_body: Indian Customs seized 102 kg of heroin hidden in a consignment of liquorice (mulethi) that was imported from Afghanistan at the Attari check post, officials said. The contraband was concealed in several cylindrical logs resembling liquorice and is worth ₹700 crore in international market, officials added. "We're taking action under NDPS Act," Customs Commissioner of Amritsar, Rahul Nangare, said.

104.title: Drinking water gets 'mixed with sewage' in Punjab; 15 fall sick
104.article_body: As many as 15 people, including seven children, have fallen ill after consuming contaminated drinking water in the Gazipur area in Punjab's Zirakpur. Residents alleged that the water supply was contaminated by sewer lines. A telecom company had dug up the area to lay wires, which has caused the mixing of water with sewage, a water supply department official claimed.

105.title: I try to direct films that aren't easy to make: Ajay Devgn
105.article_body: Ajay Devgn has said he tries to direct films that are not easy to make. "I like films that challenge me...If there's...story which inspires me so much that I feel like telling it myself, only then I direct it, otherwise, there's no point," he added. Ajay's 'Runway 34' marks his third directorial venture after 'U Me Aur Hum' and 'Shivaay'.

106.title: B'luru's 1st ANPR camera singles out 25 vehicles, recovers ₹19,900
106.article_body: First Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR) camera that was deployed in Bengaluru last week has singled out 25 vehicles with pending cases and has recovered ₹19,900 as fine. The camera takes pictures of offenders and sends details of the offenders to the police personnel stationed nearby. The police then stops the vehicle and collects the fine.

107.title: US’ Nebraska wildfires kill ex-fire chief, injure 15 firefighters
107.article_body: A retired fire chief was killed and at least 15 firefighters were injured in wildfires that swept over parts of the US' Nebraska. According to an official, 66-year-old John P Trumble was overcome by smoke and fire after his vehicle went off-road owing to poor visibility. As many as 14 counties in the state have reported blazes since Friday.

108.title: Tarundeep Rai-Ridhi Phor win their 1st mixed team gold in Archery World Cup
108.article_body: Archers Tarundeep Rai and Ridhi Phor won their maiden recurve mixed team gold as they defeated Great Britain in the final of the Archery World Cup Stage 1. It's India's second gold in the tournament after the men's compound team won on Saturday. Pairing for the first time, 38-year-old Rai and 17-year-old Ridhi won 5-4 (35-37, 36-33, 39-40, 38-37, 18-17).

109.title: Malicious: B'luru DCP on religious procession route change request
109.article_body: Bengaluru city's DCP (South Division) Harish Pandey on Monday replied to a tweet by an organisation seeking to change the route of a temple's religious procession as it passed through areas "mostly inhabited by Muslims", saying, "This is a malicious attempt to create panic." He added that the procession is 35 years old and has "always been welcomed" by residents.

110.title: A boy used to inappropriately touch me after making me strip when I was 6: Kangana
110.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, in a recent episode of 'Lock Upp', revealed that she was sexually assaulted when she was aged around six. "A young boy from our town used to inappropriately touch me...He was three to four years elder than me. Perhaps he was exploring his sexuality. He'd call us, get us all to strip and check us," Kangana said.

111.title: Ranveer, Sara, Kriti & Madhuri attend Karan Johar's party, pics surface
111.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar recently hosted a dinner party for Global TV Head of Netflix, Bela Bajaria who arrived in Mumbai recently. The paparazzi spotted Madhuri Dixit, Alia Bhatt, Ranveer Singh, Sara Ali Khan, Kriti Sanon and other celebrities arriving at Karan's residence. Meanwhile, on the professional front, Karan recently announced a schedule wrap for 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'.

112.title: 2 shot dead in car speeding towards police in Paris after Macron wins election: Report
112.article_body: Paris police have shot two people dead and severely wounded a third person, a woman, after a car came speeding towards them on the oldest bridge in the French capital, Pont Neuf, reports said. The incident took place shortly after midnight, hours after French President Emmanuel Macron won a second term and protests broke out in the capital.

113.title: Freedom of expression doesn't give anyone right to abuse India: Vijayvargiya
113.article_body: BJP National General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya has said that freedom of expression in democracy does not give anyone the right to abuse India and go unpunished. "No other country addresses its nation as 'mother'...Are you okay if someone abuses your mother? Should such people who abuse our mother not be dealt with by law?" Vijayvargiya added.

114.title: Stronger kids bullied me in school, wanted to be a boxer to fight back: Vivek
114.article_body: Actor Vivek Oberoi said that "bigger and stronger" kids bullied him in boarding school and he wanted to be boxer to be able to fight them back. "I went to my coach...and he said, 'I will train you'..I ended up boxing not just for myself but for my school...I went to state-level and even competed at the nationals," Vivek added.

115.title: Hero Vired & INSEAD collaborate to launch new management program
115.article_body: Ed-tech company Hero Vired has partnered with world's leading management institute INSEAD to offer certificate program in Strategic Management and Business Essentials in India. The program will include up to 90% live learning, with 50% teaching sessions by INSEAD faculty. The program will cater to mid-senior professionals, entrepreneurs & senior leaders looking to upgrade their leadership skills.

116.title: Scindia, Singh inaugurate 'Yog Prabha' event at Safdarjung Airport
116.article_body: Union Ministers Jyotiraditya Scindia and General VK Singh on Monday inaugurated the mega Yoga event 'Yog Prabha' at Delhi's Safdarjung Airport. Over 500 Civil Aviation Ministry and its affiliated organisations' officials participated in the event. "Common Yoga Protocol, Lecture on Yoga by Expert [and] Yoga Demonstration will be...be undertaken at the event," a statement had said earlier.

117.title: Verstappen wins Emilia Romagna GP to close title gap to 27 points
117.article_body: Red Bull's Max Verstappen won the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix to move to the second place in the season's driver standings. He's now 27 points behind the Ferrari's Charles Leclerc, who finished sixth in the race. Verstappen's teammate Sergio Perez finished second while McLaren driver Lando Norris finished third. Mercedes' seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton finished 13th.

118.title: EOW inspector, constable arrested for taking bribe from Odisha journalist
118.article_body: The CBI arrested a constable of the Economic Offences Wing (EOW), Delhi, in Bhubaneswar on the charges of taking a bribe of ₹2 lakh from a journalist based in Odisha, promising to remove his name as a witness in a case of forgery. Inspector of EOW in Delhi police was also arrested by CBI in Delhi for masterminding the crime.

119.title: BJP seeks action against Atishi over Kerala officials visit claim
119.article_body: The Delhi BJP unit has sought action against AAP MLA Atishi after she said that officials from Kerala had visited the national capital to study the "Delhi model" of education. Earlier, Kerala Education Minister V Sivankutty had said that the state government hadn't sent anyone. "It's surprising how Atishi can make such false claims," Delhi BJP spokesperson Praveen Kapoor said.

120.title: I've noticed growth in Tiger; he has become calmer now: Tara Sutaria
120.article_body: Speaking about her 'Heropanti 2' co-star Tiger Shroff, actress Tara Sutaria said, "I've...noticed his growth as a co-actor and as a friend. I feel he's calmer and cool; with age, all of us tend to calm down." "His musical talent has grown. During 'Student Of The Year 2', I...noticed him humming. In 'Heropanti 2', he's singing as well," she added.

121.title: Most COVID-19 cases in Ghaziabad seen among people aged 21-40
121.article_body: Ghaziabad has registered 371 COVID-19 cases since April 12, most of which have been reported among people aged between 21 and 40 years. As many as 145 (39%) affected patients belonged to the 21-40 years age group. At the same time, the infection rate among those over 60 years was 7.8%, making them the least affected group.

122.title: 2 brothers electrocuted to death while working in the field in Pilibhit
122.article_body: Two brothers died due to an electric shock while working in their fields in UP's Pilibhit district. The deceased, identified as Rajendra Prasad (54) and Rameshwar Dayal (46), had gone to irrigate their fields when an iron bar, held by Rajendra, touched the wire of a nearby tubewell, police said. Notably, Rameshwar died while trying to save Rajendra.

123.title: It looked like he had no intent: Vettori on Pollard's 19(20) vs LSG
123.article_body: Ex-NZ captain Daniel Vettori has said it looked like MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard "had no intent" to score during their chase of LSG's 169-run target. "LSG did bowl well...and executed their strategies well," added Vettori. Pollard came in to bat when MI were 67/4 in the 12th over and scored 19 off 20 as LSG restricted MI to 132/8.

124.title: Man stabbed to death by uncles over consumption of liquor in Meerut
124.article_body: A 20-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death by his two uncles after a spat between the three over the consumption of liquor in Meerut's Lisari Gate area. The incident took place on Sunday when the deceased, Saajid, was returning home after offering namaz, police said. Notably, the accused had objected to the consumption of liquor by Saajid.

125.title: 18-year-old India-born student drowns in US while trying to retrieve football from pond
125.article_body: Clinten Ajit, an 18-year-old Kerala-born high school student, drowned while trying to retrieve a football from a pond in New Jersey. His body was recovered nearly three hours after he had drowned. Police are still investigating the events leading up to the 18-year-old's drowning. His family had immigrated to the US in September 2012 when he was eight years old.

126.title: 4 children injured as crude bombs explode near mosque in West Bengal
126.article_body: Four children were left injured after crude bombs exploded near a local mosque in West Bengal's Malda, police said. The incident reportedly took place when the children started playing with the crude bombs after mistaking them for balls. The condition of two of the children is critical and they are undergoing treatment at the Malda Medical College and Hospital.

127.title: Dilip Joshi, Johny Lever attend wedding reception of Rakesh Bedi’s daughter
127.article_body: Veteran actor Rakesh Bedi hosted a wedding reception for his daughter Ridhima in Mumbai, which was attended by Rakesh's friends from the industry. 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' actor Dilip Joshi, Johny Lever, Ramesh Sippy, Avtar Gill, Guddi Maruti and Mukesh Rishi were among the prominent celebrities who attended the wedding reception. Ridhima got married on March 20 in Delhi.

128.title: Delhi Metro ridership yet to reach pre-pandemic levels: DMRC
128.article_body: The passenger traffic in Delhi Metro has increased both on weekdays and weekends after various COVID-19 restrictions were lifted, but the footfall is still lower than the pre-COVID-19 pandemic levels, said a Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) official. According to DMRC data, the Metro ridership has reached only up to 66% of the pre-pandemic levels.

129.title: Senior Congress leader K Sankaranarayanan passes away at 89
129.article_body: Senior Congress leader K Sankaranarayanan passed away at his residence in Kerala's Palakkad on Sunday, aged 89. During his career, Sankaranarayanan served as Governor of Maharashtra, Nagaland and Jharkhand. He held additional charges of Goa, Arunachal Pradesh and Assam as Governor. He was four-time legislator and held agriculture, finance, excise, agriculture portfolios in governments in Kerala.

130.title: India reports 2,541 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases rise to 16,522
130.article_body: India has reported 2,541 COVID-19 cases, 1,862 recoveries and 30 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,593 COVID-19 cases and 44 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 16,522, while the death toll rose to 5,22,223.

131.title: KL Rahul reprimanded for 3rd time in IPL 2022, fined ₹24-lakh for slow over-rate
131.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul has been reprimanded for the third time in IPL 2022. He has been fined ₹24 lakh after his team maintained a slow over-rate against MI on Sunday. Earlier, Rahul was fined 20% of match fee for breaching Code of Conduct against RCB. He was fined ₹12 lakh over LSG's slow over-rate against MI on April 16.

132.title: PM Modi congratulates Macron on being re-elected as French Prez
132.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday took to Twitter to congratulate Emmanuel Macron on being re-elected as the President of France, saying, "I look forward to...working together to deepen the India-France Strategic Partnership." Macron won the elections by defeating far-right leader Le Pen with around 58% votes. "I am so proud to serve you again," Macron said on winning the re-election.

133.title: Accept money KCR gives, his bank balance will reduce: T'gana BJP chief
133.article_body: While accusing Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao of misappropriating government funds, state BJP chief Bandi Sanjay said that the people of state should accept the money that he distributes. "His bank balance will reduce...or else he will become richer and...you will become poor...Whatever the money he is distributing in election it is your money given by...PM Modi," he added.

134.title: Protests in Paris after Macron wins French President election, police use teargas
134.article_body: Riot police charged and sprayed teargas on demonstrators in central Paris protesting after President Emmanuel Macron was re-elected on Sunday. Macron defeated far-right leader Marine Le Pen. Notably, Macron is the first French President to win a second term in two decades, but Le Pen's result also marks the closest the far-right has ever come to taking power in France.

135.title: Loopholes in anti-defection law, needs amendment: Vice President
135.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu called for an amendment in the anti-defection law, stating that those lawmakers switching to other parties shouldn't be offered other posts before they are re-elected. "The anti-defection law has certain loopholes. It allows wholesale defection," Naidu added. "Most of the cases of defection are not effectively dealt with and are dealt with affection," Naidu stated.

136.title: Railways to remove encroachments near Pune's Talegaon station
136.article_body: The Pune railway division has given notices to 64 illegal encroachments near the Talegaon station, asking to vacate by April 26, failing which it will take action. The authorities said they will carry out an anti-encroachment drive if the defaulters didn't vacate even after repeated instructions. The people are not cooperating with the Railways, said an official.

137.title: I'm so bad at dancing that even rehearsals don't help: Ajay Devgn
137.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said he's so bad at dancing that he never does rehearsals because they don't help. He added that he regularly asks choreographers to change steps or tell them to do it because he can't do those steps. Ajay further said that the worst thing about his film 'Golmaal' was that he had to dance in the movie.

138.title: Twitter begins deal negotiations with Tesla CEO Elon Musk: Report
138.article_body: Twitter on Sunday began deal negotiations after Tesla CEO Elon Musk pursued many of the social media company's shareholders with financing details on his $43 billion acquisition offer, according to a Reuters report. Musk has said Twitter needs to be taken private to grow and become a genuine platform for free speech.

139.title: Called Salman, said 'I've announced it, it's Eid, are you ok': Ajay on Runway 34
139.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said that he did not realise that Eid will be falling in the same week as the release of his film 'Runway 34' during the announcement of release date. "First thing I did is...I called up Salman and said 'I've announced this date...it's Eid...are you ok?'. He said 'don't worry, I won't come that week'," Ajay added.

140.title: The season hasn't gone the way we wanted it to: Rohit after 8th defeat
140.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said that the ongoing IPL season hasn't gone the way they wanted it to after they lost their eighth match in the tournament. "[LSG's 169-run target] should've been chased down, but we didn't bat well enough...it [was] important to string partnerships. But [we played] some irresponsible shots in the middle, including [me]," stated Rohit.

141.title: Right-wing groups object to B'luru school making students carry Bible
141.article_body: After a school in Bengaluru reportedly took an undertaking from parents to allow students to carry Bibles, right-wing groups objected to it, calling it a violation of the Karnataka Education Act. A Hindu Janajagruti Samiti (HJS) spokesperson claimed that it was forcing non-Christians to learn Bible's teachings. The school, however, said that it provides Bible-based education, according to reports.

142.title: Pregnant woman arrested with cocaine worth ₹51 lakh in Mumbai
142.article_body: A 30-year-old pregnant woman from Mumbai's Borivali has been arrested for possession of cocaine worth ₹51 lakh. Police said the woman, who is the wife of an ambulance driver, was using the ambulance to deliver drugs. A police team interrogated her after they spotted her standing near St Francis School, Borivali suspiciously, while holding a small transparent bag.

143.title: Labourer kills man in fight over alcohol money in Pune; arrested
143.article_body: A labourer was arrested for allegedly hitting a man on the head with a rod, leading to the latter's death, after a fight broke out between them over money for alcohol in Pune. The deceased roamed around with a head injury for two days before dying, a police officer said. Head injury had led to internal bleeding, police officer added.

144.title: Pune to have cloudy sky till April-end, rain likely on 2 days: IMD
144.article_body: Pune will continue to have cloudy weather till the end of April, IMD has predicted. "Till April 30, the forecast states that the sky shall remain cloudy," said Anupam Kashyapi, head of the weather forecasting department at IMD, Pune. The city is also likely to witness light rainfall on April 27 and 28, Kashyapi added.

145.title: CSK's Devon Conway marries longtime girlfriend, pic surfaces
145.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) cricketer Devon Conway married his longtime girlfriend Kim in South Africa. Sharing a picture of the couple from their wedding on social media, CSK wrote, "We pronounce you Lion and Lady! Happy #WeddingWhistles to Kim & Conway!" Conway and Kim had got engaged in 2020.

146.title: Indian Idol 12 fame Sayli Kamble marries boyfriend Dhawal, pics surface
146.article_body: Indian Idol 12's second runner-up Sayli Kamble married her boyfriend Dhawal in a traditional Maharashtrian style wedding in Kalyan. The couple had got engaged in December last year. Sayli's co-contestants from Indian Idol 12, Nachiket Lele and Nihal Tauro, attended the wedding. Sayli is currently seen as a captain on Superstar Singer Season 2.

147.title: Krunal jumps on Pollard, kisses him after taking his wicket; video goes viral
147.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing LSG all-rounder Krunal Pandya jumping on MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard and kissing him after dismissing him in their IPL 2022 match on Sunday. Krunal dismissed Pollard on the first delivery of MI's last over. Pollard got out for 19(20). Earlier in the match, Pollard had dismissed Krunal.

148.title: 752 incidents of snatching reported in Delhi in last one month: Police data
148.article_body: Around 752 incidents of snatching were reported in Delhi in the last one month, with an average of 24 such cases per day, police data shows. A total of 1,746 persons have been arrested in the last four months, including 1,237 first-time offenders. Till April 20, 3,063 such incidents were reported, compared to 2,899 in the same period last year.

149.title: French President Emmanuel Macron wins 2nd term, defeats far-right leader Le Pen
149.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron has won the re-election, defeating far-right rival Marine Le Pen. With 97% of votes counted, Macron was on course for 57.4% of the vote, interior ministry figures showed. "Many in this country voted for me not because they support my ideas but to keep out those of the far-right. I want to thank them," he said.

150.title: Man says 2 unidentified men lying on Hyd road, asks police to save them
150.article_body: A Twitter user shared pictures on the microblogging site, claiming that there are two unidentified men lying on a Hyderabad road. "In Dilsukhnagar...Two unidentified men lying on the road near pillar number A1529...Please save them or move them to a safer place," he wrote. Police responded to his tweet by saying that the staff had enquired about the person.

151.title: MI's winless run in IPL 2022 continues as LSG hand them their 8th straight defeat
151.article_body: LSG defeated MI by 36 runs in their IPL 2022 clash at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai on Sunday. MI have now lost each of their first eight matches in the tournament. LSG put up a total of 168/6, with captain KL Rahul scoring his fourth IPL hundred. MI were restricted to 132/8. LSG's Krunal Pandya recorded figures of 4-0-19-3.

152.title: Most wanted BKI terrorist Patialavi arrested by Punjab Police
152.article_body: The Punjab Police's Anti-Gangster Task Force on Sunday arrested the most wanted Babbar Khalsa International (BKI) terrorist Charanjit Singh alias Patialavi. The accused, who was absconding since 2010, was arrested near Gurudwara Sahib in Dera Bassi following information of him visiting the area. According to officials, Patialavi was wanted in Ludhiana's Shingar cinema bomb blast case among others.

153.title: Guj hospital security guard assaulted, stabbed over parking issue
153.article_body: A 21-year-old hospital security guard in Gujarat's Ahmedabad was allegedly assaulted and stabbed when he tried to intervene between two men fighting over parking on Saturday. The victim, Sandeep Parihar, was admitted to ICU after the incident. Parihar said that one of the men slapped him before another took out a sharp weapon and stabbed him in the stomach.

154.title: Rahul Gandhi, Congress biggest strength of PM Modi: KT Rama Rao
154.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Sunday alleged that Congress is the main reason BJP is getting stronger day by day. He added, "Rahul Gandhi and Congress party is the biggest strength of (PM) Narendra Modi." KTR has further challenged PM Modi and the BJP to take responsibility for mass killings and conflicts or communal incidents happening across the country.

155.title: Thousands of students protest outside Sri Lankan PM's home
155.article_body: Thousands of university students protested outside the home of Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa on Sunday, calling for him to resign over his handling of the economic crisis. "You can block the road, but can't stop our struggle until the...government goes home," a student protester said. The police claimed that Rajapaksa wasn't at home at the time of the protest.

156.title: SP MLA Ravidas Mehrotra not allowed to meet Azam Khan in UP jail
156.article_body: Samajwadi Party MLA Ravidas Mehrotra has claimed that officials in UP's Sitapur jail didn't allow him to meet party leader Azam Khan who is lodged there. He added that they didn't even agree to hand over the Iftar food which he had taken for him. Notably, Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia chief and Akhilesh Yadav's uncle Shivpal Yadav met Khan on Friday.

157.title: India, EU aligned in fight against climate change: EU chief
157.article_body: At the headquarters of International Solar Alliance in Gurugram, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said, "India and...EU are aligned in the fight against climate change." "We've both embarked on our way to net zero. And solar energy will play a key role in getting there," she added. "We'll step up our cooperation on solar energy," she further said.

158.title: Ex-Cong MLA Manilal Vaghela joins BJP ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls
158.article_body: Former Congress MLA Manilal Vaghela joined the BJP on Sunday in the Vadgam town of Banaskantha district ahead of Gujarat Assembly elections due this year. Vaghela had resigned from Congress last year, citing displeasure over the party sidelining him. Notably, Vaghela had won from Vadgam in 2012 Assembly polls but was denied a ticket from the constituency in 2017 elections.

159.title: SII urges Centre to use 10 crore Covishield vaccines given by GAVI
159.article_body: The Serum Institute of India (SII) urged the Centre to immediately use the 10 crore Covishield doses provided free of cost by vaccine alliance GAVI amid rising coronavirus cases, PTI reported. SII said if the doses aren't taken by the government timely, it'll lead to wastage of the vaccines. India reported 2,593 new cases in 24 hours to Sunday morning.

160.title: Odisha Special Task Force seizes 3 elephant tusks, 1 arrested
160.article_body: The Odisha Special Task Force (STF) along with Birmaharajpur forest officials on Sunday seized three elephant tusks weighing 10 kg each after conducting a raid near a village in the Subarnapur district. One person has been arrested and an enquiry is underway. The search was a part of an ongoing special drive against the wildlife criminals and poachers.

161.title: Muslims host Hindu girl's wedding at own home as she couldn't book hall in UP
161.article_body: A Muslim family in UP's Azamgarh offered their home for the marriage function of a Hindu girl in their neighbourhood. Pooja, who lost her father to COVID-19, reportedly couldn't afford to book a marriage hall and her family's house didn't have enough space to hold the function. "[Parvez's] family treated (wedding) guests as if Pooja is their...daughter," said her uncle.

162.title: If you've worked on smart watches & phones, please join Neuralink: Musk
162.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "If you've engineered or manufactured smart watches or phones, please join Neuralink. Your skills are directly applicable." Co-founded by Musk in 2016, Neuralink is a neurotechnology company that is developing implantable brain-machine interfaces to help people with paralysis. In a recent interview, Musk suggested Neuralink could help treat morbid obesity.

163.title: Punjab govt orders probe against 720 schools for raising fees
163.article_body: The Punjab government on Sunday ordered an inquiry against 720 private schools for allegedly raising their fee despite the government's order prohibiting a fee hike. The government ordered the probe based on complaints from parents who claimed the schools disregarded the government's directions. "Strict action will be taken if [schools are] found guilty," said Education Minister GSM Hayer.

164.title: Sniffer dog of MP police stolen by 4 people from backside of temple
164.article_body: A sniffer dog of Madhya Pradesh police was stolen from tourist town Orchha, police said on Sunday. Four persons travelling in an SUV took the dog away from the backside of a temple after it ran away in panic due to the bursting of firecrackers from its handler, an official said quoting the complaint.

165.title: 61-yr-old Sean, 30-yr-old Leila finalise divorce two years after 'COVID wedding'
165.article_body: Hollywood's 61-year-old actor Sean Penn and 30-year-old actress Leila George have finalised their divorce almost two years after getting married in July 2020. A month after their marriage, Penn appeared on a talk show and said that the couple had a "COVID wedding". "It was a county commissioner on Zoom and we were at the house," Penn had said.

166.title: Ukraine war indicates fossil fuel dependency not sustainable: EU chief
166.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on her visit to India said, "In Europe, Russia's war in Ukraine [is] a stark reminder that our dependency on Russian fossil fuels isn't sustainable." She added, "Our transition to home-grown energy is also an investment in our security." The EU Commission will present next month a new solar strategy under RePowerEU.

167.title: Europe needs to work with India to combat climate change: EU chief
167.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen, who's on a two-day visit to India, said on Sunday that Europe needs to work with India to combat climate change. She added that while Europe is on path to climate neutrality with 'EU green deal', saving the planet is a global effort. "We count on...young people, to keep fighting for...climate," she added.

168.title: Oman secures release of 14 foreigners held by Yemen's Houthi rebels
168.article_body: Oman's Foreign Ministry on Sunday tweeted that it had facilitated the release of 14 foreigners who were held by Houthi rebels in Yemen. They were transferred from Yemen's Sanaa to Muscat, it added. The people freed included a British man, his wife and child, seven Indian nationals, a Filipino, an Indonesian, an Ethiopian and a Myanmar national, it further said.

169.title: 10 more Shiv Sena workers arrested for ruckus outside BJP MP's house
169.article_body: Khar Police on Sunday arrested 10 more Shiv Sena workers for allegedly creating a ruckus outside BJP MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana's house in Mumbai. "A total of 16 workers have been arrested...Police will present everyone in the court [on Monday]," Mumbai Police said. Both Ravi and Navneet have been sent to 14-days judicial custody.

170.title: India's oil imports nearly double to $119.2 billion in FY22
170.article_body: India imported 212.2 million tonnes of crude oil, worth $119.2 billion, in the fiscal year that ended on March 31, Petroleum Ministry's data showed. This is nearly double the $62.2 billion that India spent on 196.5 million tonnes of oil in the previous fiscal. India bought $13.7 billion-oil in March alone, when oil prices surged to 14-year high.

171.title: Barmy Army share pic of Sachin's dismissal in birthday post, fans react
171.article_body: England's Barmy Army took to social media to share a picture of Sachin Tendulkar's dismissal while wishing him on his birthday. "Why this pic?" a fan commented on the post. "A lion against a pack of wolves...that's what I see," another wrote. Other comments read, "[They] willingly selected this image" and "This won't give England an Ashes series victory."

172.title: Bill Murray accused of inappropriate behaviour on 'Being Mortal' set: Report
172.article_body: The shooting of 'Being Mortal' which stars Bill Murray, Aziz Ansari and Seth Rogan has been suspended over Bill's "inappropriate behaviour." As per Page Six, some women felt uncomfortable and he crossed a line after being "very hands-on touchy". The 71-year-old had reportedly put an arm around a woman, touched her hair and pulled her ponytail in a "comedic way".

173.title: Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif to visit Saudi Arabia on April 27: Reports
173.article_body: Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif is likely to visit Saudi Arabia on April 27, local media has reported. This comes after names of several politicians, including PM Sharif, were removed from country's Exit Control List (ECL). The ECL is an ordinance to provide for the control of exit of certain persons from Pakistan who have been involved in any economic offence.

174.title: Massive fire breaks out in Delhi railway godown, 14 fire engines reach spot
174.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a godown in Sabzi Mandi railway station in Delhi on Sunday. A total of 14 fire tenders reached the spot and the blaze was brought under control. A video that has surfaced online shows trains being present at the station at the time of the incident, while the area was covered with smoke.

175.title: We didn't say Kerala govt officials had come to Delhi: AAP's Atishi
175.article_body:
