AAP MLA Atishi replied after Kerala Education Minister V Sivankutty questioned her claim that Delhi government hosted Kerala officials who wanted to study Delhi education model. Atishi said, "I would like to request Kerala Education Minister to check facts before tweeting." 
"We didn't say...Kerala government officials had come to Delhi. Kerala CBSE school management officials had come," she said.

176.title: Crypto profits grew 400% in 2021 to $162.7 bn: Chainalysis
176.article_body: Crypto investors gained a total of $162.7 billion in 2021, a 400% increase from just $32.5 billion in 2020, a report by data analytics firm Chainalysis revealed. As per the report, the US investors profited the most (around $47 billion), followed by the UK, Germany and China. India came 21st, with $1.85 billion in total realised gains, the report added.

177.title: Trans people can register themselves, avail benefits: UP govt plan
177.article_body: The Social Welfare Ministry of Uttar Pradesh has proposed a first of its kind voluntary registration for transgender people in the state, aimed at formulating welfare measures for the community, according to reports. The ministry has proposed a budget of ₹200 crore for the welfare of transgenders by means of providing them with education facilities, providing basic amenities and more.

178.title: Religare Enterprises resolves all legacy issues with SEBI
178.article_body: Religare Enterprises Limited (REL) on Sunday said it has resolved all legacy issues with market regulator SEBI. REL said the overlooked compliance requirements pointed out by SEBI took place when the firm's control and management rested with former promoters Malvinder and Shivinder Mohan Singh. "The erstwhile promoters have already been reclassified as public shareholders," REL added.

179.title: New Pakistani govt removes PM Shehbaz Sharif from no-fly list
179.article_body: Pakistan's new government has amended rules pertaining to the Exit Control List (ECL),  dealing with people not allowed to leave the country. PM Shehbaz Sharif, his niece Maryam Nawaz Sharif, ex-PM Shahid Khaqan Abbasi and Finance Minister Miftah Ismail were among the people removed from the list. Around 3,000 people have benefitted due to the changes, the Interior Minister said.

180.title: Doing a remake of a film has its pros and cons: Janhvi Kapoor
180.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor in an interview has stated that doing a remake of a film has its pros and cons, adding that you know it's a film that has been loved by a large group of people. "It is a fun balance between still respecting the material and the intention with which the material was made," the actress added.

181.title: Dad Shammi Kapoor didn't tell us before marrying Neila Devi: Son
181.article_body: Late veteran actor Shammi Kapoor's son Aditya has revealed that his father didn't tell him or his sister before marrying second wife Neila Devi. Aditya added that he was 13 years old and at his aunt's place at the time. "He married in the morning...When I met him in the evening, he told me...Neila Devi is my mother," Aditya added.

182.title: Arjun wishes Varun on his b'day with an 'Andaz Apna Apna' dialogue
182.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor shared a video of Varun Dhawan on his 35th birthday on Instagram. Varun called Arjun a 'lady killer' in the video. Quoting a line from the 1994 film 'Andaz Apna Apna', Arjun wrote, "Yeh Aadmi purush hi nahi mahapurush hai (He's not just a man but a great man)...You predicted me being a Lady Killer in 2015!"

183.title: Didn't want to be just R Madhavan's son: Vedaant after winning Danish Open gold
183.article_body: Vedaant Madhavan, who recently won a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022 in Copenhagen, said in an interview with DD News that he wants to make a name for himself. "I didn't wanna live under my dad's shadow...I didn't want to be just (actor) R Madhavan's son," said the teenager.

184.title: 3 LeT terrorists killed in encounter with security forces in J&K
184.article_body: At least three Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorists were killed by security forces during an encounter in Pahoo area of Pulwama district in Jammu and Kashmir on Sunday. The terrorists fired upon the security personnel, who retaliated. On Saturday, two Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) terrorists were killed during the encounter in the Mirhama area.

185.title: US Prez Biden marks 'Armenian genocide', vows to 'stop atrocities'
185.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Sunday commemorated the 107th anniversary of the start of the 'Armenian genocide'. "We recommit ourselves to speaking out and stopping atrocities that leave lasting scars on the world,” Biden said. The 'genocide' refers to the time period in 1915 when an estimated 1.5 million Christian Armenians were massacred, expelled from erstwhile Ottoman Empire (present-day Turkey).

186.title: Moving on from making fun of Bill Gates for shorting Tesla: Musk
186.article_body: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO, Elon Musk, on Sunday tweeted, "Moving on..." After several Twitter users began guessing that Musk is moving on from his desire to buy Twitter, Musk tweeted, "(from making fun of Gates for shorting Tesla while claiming to support climate change action)". Earlier, Musk admitted to confronting Bill Gates on shorting Tesla stock.

187.title: My hero: Sambha actor Mac Mohan's daughter on his birth anniversary
187.article_body: Late actor Mac Mohan's daughter Vinati Makijany penned a note for him on his birth anniversary on social media, writing, "Happy Birthday my HERO. They don't make them like you anymore Papa." The actor was known for portraying the role of Sambha in 1975 film 'Sholay'. Vinati further wrote, "I wish I could hold you just one more time."

188.title: Chinese authorities erect fences outside Shanghai's COVID-hit areas
188.article_body: Authorities in China's Shanghai have erected fences outside residential buildings in an effort to impose a COVID-19 lockdown. China has imposed strict lockdowns in response to outbreaks as part of its 'zero-COVID' policy. "This is so disrespectful of the rights of...people inside, using metal barriers to enclose them like domestic animals," a Chinese social media user said on Weibo.

189.title: CBI arrests 3 more in gang-rape, murder of minor girl in WB's Nadia
189.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation arrested three more accused of the alleged gang-rape and murder of a minor girl in West Bengal's Nadia district. "During the course of the investigation, the role of the said accused has allegedly been found and, accordingly, they have been arrested," read a statement. She was allegedly raped on April 4 at a birthday party.

190.title: KL Rahul becomes second Indian to slam 4 hundreds in IPL
190.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul has become the second Indian batter after Virat Kohli to slam four hundreds in IPL. The 30-year-old smashed his fourth hundred in IPL off 61 deliveries against MI on Sunday. It is Rahul's second hundred in IPL 2022, with both the hundreds coming against MI. Notably, Kohli has hit five hundreds in IPL.

191.title: UPI server faces outage, users from across India complain of failed payments
191.article_body: The Unified Payments Interface (UPI) server appeared to be down for more than an hour on Sunday evening, causing disruptions in payments across India. Several users took to Twitter to complain about failed payments on major UPI apps, including PhonePe, Google Pay and Paytm. The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) is yet to issue a statement on the outage.

192.title: FM Sitharaman urges Indian diaspora to become partners in growth
192.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday urged the Indian diaspora to become partners in India's growth in the next 25 years. Addressing the Indian community in Silicon Valley, San Francisco Bay Area, Sitharaman spoke about structural reforms undertaken by the Centre. She also highlighted the stellar contributions of Indian diaspora in US, especially their role in innovation and research.

193.title: Your performance in 'KGF 2' was just mind-blowing: Ram Charan to Yash
193.article_body: Actor Ram Charan, taking to Twitter, congratulated the makers of 'KGF: Chapter 2' for the success of their film and praised actor Yash for his performance in the film. "CONGRATULATIONS to my brother Prashanth Neel...and the entire team for the massive success of 'KGF: Chapter 2'," he tweeted. "Rocky! Dear brother Yash, your performance was just mind-blowing," Ram further wrote.

194.title: Russia's flag carrier Aeroflot to resume Maldives flights from May 13
194.article_body: Russia's flag carrier Aeroflot will resume its flights to the Maldives from May 13, the Maldives Civil Aviation Authority said on Sunday. Aeroflot will operate one daily flight between the two countries, the aviation authority added. The move comes after Aeroflot suspended flights to the Maldives on March 8, following the Russian invasion of Ukraine in February.

195.title: Russia might mine Bitcoin amid sanctions to generate hard cash: IMF
195.article_body: Russia might sidestep Western sanctions by using its unwanted energy exports to mine Bitcoin to generate hard cash, IMF said in its recent Global Financial Stability Report. Russia could also use crypto exchanges that don't comply with the sanctions to carry out transactions, the report added. It urged countries to consider amending laws to take crypto assets into account.

196.title: SC grants bail to Bihar woman whose cousin drove her scooty with liquor
196.article_body: The Supreme Court has granted anticipatory bail to a woman from Patna who was booked after her cousin was found driving her scooty with nine liquor bottles. The 21-year-old woman was booked under the prohibition law. The court said, "The scooty, though belonging to her, was not being driven by her at the relevant point of time."

197.title: Top US officials to visit Kyiv to discuss supply of arms: Zelenskyy
197.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin will visit the Ukrainian capital Kyiv on Sunday. Blinken and Austin will be the most senior US officials to visit the country since the start of the invasion on February 24. Ukraine's call for more powerful weapons will be discussed during the visit, according to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

198.title: Bus with 50 passengers overturns in Odisha, 25 injured
198.article_body: A bus carrying 50 passengers from Odisha's Puri to Tamil Nadu overturned on the highway near Rambha in the Ganjam district on Sunday leaving 25 people injured. Four of them survived major injuries, police said. The District Magistrate and Chhatrapur Sub-Collector visited the spot. Notably, a highway widening project is underway near the accident spot.

199.title: Hindus, Muslims organise 'Tiranga Yatra' in Jahangirpuri; call for peace
199.article_body: Hindus and Muslims of the riot-hit Jahangirpuri in Delhi took out a 'Tiranga Yatra' on Sunday to promote communal harmony. Around 50 people each from both sides took part in the procession amid heavy police deployment. The yatra started from Kusal Chowk and then moved towards Block B, BC market, mosque, temple, Bhumi Ghat and culminated at Azad Chowk.

200.title: Old video of 35,000 people singing Happy Birthday for Sachin during IPL goes viral
200.article_body: On the occasion of Sachin Tendulkar's birthday, an old video of thousands of people singing the birthday song for him has gone viral on Twitter. The video, shot during IPL 2018 in Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium, shows Sachin smiling and covering his face as people sing 'Happy Birthday' for him. Tendulkar turns 49 today.

201.title: TCS could become the world's largest IT company: CEO
201.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services' (TCS) CEO Rajesh Gopinathan said, "Absolutely. In many ways, we already are," when he was asked if the Indian IT services major could become the world's largest IT company. Gopinathan also said, "Today we are $25 billion in size...There is no reason we shouldn't aspire to be double, triple, quadruple of the size we are today."

202.title: Randeep Hooda shares 'Extraction' action sequence to mark 2 yrs
202.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda shared a video of an action sequence from the film 'Extraction' on social media to mark two years of its release on Sunday. He wrote in the caption, "That was fun. Wishing team #Extraction all the best for #Extraction2." Randeep had previously hurt his knee during the film's shoot for which he had to undergo surgery.

203.title: Two-thirds of all Android phones sold in 2021 put user privacy at risk: Report
203.article_body: Check Point Research claimed two-thirds of all Android phones sold in 2021 put the privacy of users at risk. Check Point discovered vulnerabilities in the ALAC audio coding format that could've led an attacker to remotely get access to media and audio conversations. "MediaTek and Qualcomm, two of the largest mobile chipset manufacturers, used ALAC in their handsets," it added.

204.title: Umran bowling yorkers at that pace makes him very dangerous: McGrath
204.article_body: Glenn McGrath, speaking about SRH pacer Umran Malik, has said, "If you have a bowler bowling at that pace, I'm sure the selectors will be very interested." McGrath added, "Bowling...yorker is a lot tougher...the fact...he's able to bowl one at that pace makes him very dangerous." Umran has taken 10 wickets in seven matches so far in IPL 2022.

205.title: Will issue COVID-19 guidelines after meeting with PM Modi: Bommai
205.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday said the state government will issue COVID-19 guidelines after a video conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on April 27 regarding the ongoing situation. "The central government has given instructions to take precautions regarding COVID-19. Scientists are doing research on COVID-19 variants...People must take precautions," Bommai added.

206.title: MRI machine sucks oxygen cylinder at MP hospital, no one injured
206.article_body: Staff at Shalby Hospital in MP's Indore managed to avert a mishap after the MRI machine sucked an oxygen cylinder while a patient was being shifted on a stretcher. "The staff turned the machine off immediately," staff members said, adding the patient wasn't injured. According to staff, the ward boy had allegedly forgotten to remove the cylinder from the stretcher.

207.title: Rishabh Pant is showing glimpses of MS Dhoni behind the stump: Kuldeep
207.article_body: Delhi Capitals spinner Kuldeep Yadav said Rishabh Pant is showing glimpses of former India captain MS Dhoni behind the stumps. "Pant guides well...stays calm on the field," Kuldeep added. "Wicketkeepers play...big role in the success of spinners...credit for my performance in IPL 2022 goes to Pant as well," he stated. Kuldeep has taken 13 wickets in seven matches so far.

208.title: Incidents of violence in country systematic conspiracy of BJP: Chavan
208.article_body: Former Chief Minister of Maharashtra Prithviraj Chavan on Sunday said that the incidents of violence in the country are a systematic conspiracy of the BJP. "The BJP is deliberately trying to disrupt law and order. No protests are reported from the senior level of the BJP. This means that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has tacitly agreed to it," he said.

209.title: Ukraine seeks equipment from IAEA to keep running nuclear plants
209.article_body: Ukraine has submitted a list of equipment to the International Atomic Energy Agency that it needs to operate nuclear power plants, IAEA Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi said. This includes radiation measurement devices, protective material, computer-related assistance, power supply systems and diesel generators, he added. Grossi is due to visit the defunct Chornobyl nuclear plant next week.

210.title: Gujarat Cong leader Gadhvi joins AAP, says 'starting new inning'
210.article_body: Gujarat Congress leader Kailash Gadhvi joined Aam Aadmi Party in Ahmedabad on Sunday. Addressing the media at the party office, he said, "Today, I'm starting a new inning", adding, "I'm not here to talk about old things but talk about a new Gujarat". Gadhvi had earlier met AAP convener Arvind Kejriwal and said he'll join the party with 300 supporters.

211.title: Delhi sees over 1,000 new COVID-19 cases for 3rd straight day, 1 death recorded
211.article_body: Delhi on Sunday reported 1,083 new COVID-19 cases, marking the third consecutive day with over 1,000 new cases. One related death and 812 recoveries were also recorded in Delhi on Sunday. The national capital's daily positivity rate came down slightly from Saturday's 4.8% to 4.48% on Sunday.

212.title: T'gana only state to have given accreditation to 18,000 journalists: TRS MLC
212.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha on Sunday said that CM K Chandrashekar Rao had allotted ₹100 crore for the welfare of journalists in Telangana, adding that it's the only state to have given accreditation to 18,000 journalists. She stated that ₹1 lakh will be given to families of deceased journalists. Additionally, their kin will receive a ₹3,000 pension for five years.

213.title: B'luru is the identity of youth of India: PM on Khelo India games
213.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on the occasion of the inauguration of Khelo India University Games in Bengaluru said the city is the identity of India's youth. "The organisation of the Khelo India University Games in Bengaluru will add to the energy of this beautiful city," he added. PM Modi said first mantra to be successful in sports is team spirit.

214.title: KCR ropes in Prashant Kishor's I-PAC to campaign for 2023 T'gana polls
214.article_body: CM K Chandrashekar Rao's Telangana Rashtra Samithi has roped in political strategist Prashant Kishor's firm I-PAC to lead its campaign for the 2023 state polls, party leader KT Rama Rao said. "I-PAC is working for us officially. We aren't working with Prashant Kishor but we are working with I-PAC," he added. This comes amid reports of Kishor joining Congress.

215.title: Hashtags don't really help posts get more views: Instagram chief
215.article_body: Adding hashtags to Instagram posts does not help in increasing the posts' views, the social media platform's chief Adam Mosseri said. Responding to an Instagram user when he was asked if "hashtags help views", Mosseri said, "I wouldn’t...think of hashtags as a way to...get more distribution." He added that hashtags help Instagram's algorithm in understanding what the post is about.

216.title: BJP govt doing whatever they want, killing democracy: Akhilesh Yadav
216.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday met the family of the female Inspector who died by suicide in Amethi and said that police are taking such steps because they have to work under pressure. "Yogi Adityanath government is doing whatever they want and killing democracy," he said, adding that SP will raise the matter in the upcoming Assembly session.

217.title: 100-yr-old Brazilian man works at same firm for 84 years, sets world record
217.article_body: A 100-year-old Brazilian man entered the Guinness World Record book for working for the longest time at the same company. Walter Orthmann started on the factory floor of a company, which is now known as RenauxView, 84 years ago and continues to work there. "You can't just do any job to say that you're working. That doesn't work," Orthmann said.

218.title: At least spare the dead: Cong to Rana Kapoor for allegations on Patel, Deora
218.article_body: Congress termed Yes Bank Co-founder Rana Kapoor's allegations against late leaders Murli Deora and Ahmed Patel, and party leader, Priyanka Gandhi, "political vendetta". "At least spare the dead," Congress said. Kapoor alleged he was "forced" to buy an MF Husain painting from Priyanka for ₹2 crore for funding Sonia's treatment and Patel told him, "You're (Kapoor) doing a good deed".

219.title: Mahindra tags Elon Musk in tweet calling Indian bullock cart 'original Tesla'
219.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra tweeted a message on the Indian bullock cart, which called the latter the "original Tesla vehicle". "No Google Map required, no fuel to buy, no pollution, fully self-driven...relax, take a nap, reach your destination," said the message. "Back to the future," said Mahindra, while tagging Tesla CEO Elon Musk in the tweet.

220.title: I've become increasingly indifferent to social media trolling: Janhvi
220.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor, speaking about social media trolling, has said, "I have become increasingly indifferent to it." "But time and again...I'm always a little surprised...by just the double standards sometimes. And how bitter some people can be, but...it's not a big deal," she further said. On the work front, Janhvi will next be seen in 'Good Luck Jerry'.

221.title: Women's Commission can't issue notice to Chandrababu Naidu: TDP
221.article_body: Telugu Desam Party's (TDP) Varla Ramaiah has claimed that Andhra Pradesh Women's Commission chairperson Vasireddy Padma doesn't have authority to issue notices to Chandrababu Naidu and ex-party MLA Bonda Uma. The commission issued notices after Padma accused Naidu of outraging her modesty and insulting her at a Vijayawada government hospital. They had assembled there to meet a gangrape survivor.

222.title: 10 of 26 people from missing Japanese boat confirmed dead
222.article_body: Authorities in Japan on Sunday announced the death of 10 people who were found by rescuers after a tour boat they were on went missing on Saturday. There were 26 people, including two children and two crew members, on the boat when it sent a distress signal. The authorities have continued their search for the remaining 16 people.

223.title: 'Pushpa 2' will have too many catchy lines: Dialogue writer Vissa
223.article_body: 'Pushpa: The Rise' dialogue writer Srikanth Vissa has said the audience will witness too many catchy lines in the sequel to the 2021 film. "In 'Pushpa: The Rise' it worked, in the second part, we are expecting it to be bigger and better," he stated. "There's unbelievable pressure. We have to exceed the expectations and work towards it," he added.

224.title: PM Modi receives the first Lata Deenanath Mangeshkar Award
224.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday received the first Lata Deenanath Mangeshkar Award. April 24 marks the 80th death anniversary of Master Deenanath Mangeshkar, the late singing legend Lata Mangeshkar's father. "When the award is in the name of an elder sister...like Lata Didi, it's a symbol of her...love for me...It's not possible for me not to accept," PM said.

225.title: 17 lakh Indians contracted HIV in last 10 yrs due to unprotected sex
225.article_body: More than 17 lakh people contracted HIV in the country in the last 10 years due to unprotected intercourse, according to the data from the National Aids Control Organization. However, there has also been a declining trend in such HIV cases during the decade. The highest number of such cases were reported in Andhra Pradesh at 3,18,814.

226.title: KKR are good enough to be in IPL 2022 playoffs: Head coach McCullum
226.article_body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum has said that his team is good enough to enter the playoffs of IPL 2022. This comes after KKR have lost four consecutive matches in the ongoing tournament and are placed seventh on the points table. "We'll just keep working hard...hopefully, things will work out," he added. KKR will next face DC on April 28.

227.title: MI to bowl first against LSG in their first match at Wankhede since 2019
227.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. MI are playing at the Wankhede Stadium for the first time since May 5, 2019. MI are fielding the same playing XI, while Mohsin Khan has replaced Avesh Khan in LSG's playing XI.

228.title: Twitter bans misleading ads contradicting climate change science
228.article_body: Twitter announced on Earth Day that it is banning misleading advertisements that go against the scientific consensus on climate change from its platform. "We believe that climate denialism shouldn't be monetised on Twitter," the micro-blogging site stated. The announcement, however, didn't indicate if the change would affect what users post on the micro-blogging site.

229.title: Guinea's ousted Prez Conde freed from house arrest after 7 months
229.article_body: Ex-Guinea President Alpha Conde has been freed from house arrest seven months after he was ousted from power by a military coup, country's interim government said on Friday. Conde, 84, is now allowed to receive visitors, including family members. Conde, who became Guinea's first democratically-elected president in 2010, was overthrown in September 2021 on allegations of fostering state corruption.

230.title: Mumbai lawyer, associate held for trying to extort ₹4cr from a developer
230.article_body: Two people, including a lawyer, have been arrested in Mumbai for allegedly trying to extort ₹4 crore from a developer, who is executing a project in Panchsheel Nagar in Chembur. Some of the tenants had filed a complaint against him and were demanding money to withdraw it. The developer approached the Mumbai Crime Branch and the arrests were made subsequently.

231.title: Anurag Thakur inaugurates Khelo India University Games in B'luru
231.article_body: Union Youth Affairs and Sports Minister Anurag Thakur on Sunday inaugurated the first edition of the Khelo India University Games 2021 in Bengaluru. "I'm confident that you'll see a lot of the participants of Khelo India University Games 2021 representing India at the international level," Thakur said. A light and sound show was also organised at the ceremony.

232.title: Felt humiliated when Hindi cinema was shown as Indian cinema at event: Chiranjeevi
232.article_body: Chiranjeevi revealed that he felt "very humiliated" and 'insulted' when at a pre-award ceremony government function in Delhi, South Indian film stars and filmmakers weren't given space on a wall portraying Indian cinema. Talking about the 1989 event, Chiranjeevi said, "They portrayed Hindi cinema as Indian cinema. While other films were categorised as 'regional films' and were not given respect."

233.title: Complete breakdown of law & order: Chidambaram on bulldozer demolitions
233.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Sunday said that the recent bulldozer-enabled demolitions reflect a "complete breakdown of law and order", alleging that the method of removing encroachments is aimed at Muslims and the poor. He further said that the BJP leaders' justification of bulldozer-enabled demolitions "flies in the face of the law."

234.title: Going forward Babar Azam will be among legends of cricket: Harbhajan
234.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan has said that it's too early to place Pakistan skipper Babar Azam in the 'Fab Four'. "But Babar has the quality, he is a proper batsman with so much confidence...technique. Going forward he will be one of the legends of cricket," Harbhajan added. Virat Kohli, Joe Root, Steve Smith and Kane Williamson are considered the 'Fab Four'.

235.title: LPU faculty member 'insults' Lord Ram, says he's not a good person; sacked
235.article_body: Lovely Professional University (LPU) has sacked a member of its teaching faculty after a video surfaced online in which she is allegedly seen insulting the Hindu god Ram. "Actually, Ram is not a good person by heart. Ram is not a good person at all. Ravana is a good person. I find Ram is a cunning person," the woman said.

236.title: Dogecoin payment sent over 160 km without using internet for the first time
236.article_body: A Dogecoin developer has successfully conducted the first Dogecoin payment without using the internet through a protocol called 'RadioDoge'. The developer tweeted that 4.2069 Dogecoin was sent over 160 km using libdogecoin, a programming library for creating Dogecoin projects, and radio. They added that the recipient used Starlink satellite network to relay the transfer to the Dogecoin mainnet.

237.title: Massive fire breaks out at a garage in Kolkata; no one injured
237.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a garage on Tangra Christopher Road in central Kolkata at around 3 pm on Sunday, officials said. No one was injured in the blaze, they added. Eight fire tenders were sent to the spot to douse the blaze, they said, adding that the cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained.

238.title: Mahira Sharma walks out of interview over 'bodyshaming' question
238.article_body: Mahira Sharma, known for participating in 'Bigg Boss 13', walked out of an interview. The now-deleted viral video showed the host introducing her saying, "Sometimes people call you fat, sometimes they say you're too skinny and a similar thing has been happening with her of late." Mahira interrupted the host saying, "It is not a good question," before walking out.

239.title: Cong extorts money from powerful people: Malviya on painting issue
239.article_body: BJP's Amit Malviya has accused Congress of "extorting" money from people in positions of power. He alleged that Congress was selling India's highest civilian honour. Malviya's remarks came after Yes Bank co-founder Rana Kapoor told ED he was compelled to buy MF Husain painting from Priyanka Gandhi at ₹2 crore, adding that he wouldn't be considered for Padma Bhushan otherwise.

240.title: 5 members of a family get life term for killing 3 in Gurugram
240.article_body: Five members of a family were sentenced to life imprisonment by a Gurugram court on Friday for beating three of their neighbours, a woman and her two sons, to death during a quarrel. The judge also asked the convicts to pay a fine of ₹65,000 each. The quarrel had started over construction material kept in front of convicts' house.

241.title: Police allowed attack under MVA govt pressure: Fadnavis on Somaiya attack
241.article_body: Following the alleged attack on BJP leader Kirit Somaiya, former Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said that police allowed Shiv Sena workers to carry it out under the pressure of the Maha Vikas Aghadi government. Maharashtra BJP president Chandrakant Patil alleged that the MVA government is doing violence with the help of police.

242.title: Improper to name airport after me: Yediyurappa to K'taka CM
242.article_body: Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Sunday said he felt that naming the under-construction airport at Shivamogga after him is "not a proper decision". In a letter to Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai, Yediyurappa said, "I express my gratitude...[but] request you to revisit the decision." Bommai said the airport will be ready for inauguration in December this year.

243.title: World's top palm oil producer Indonesia bans exports
243.article_body: Indonesia, which is the world's top palm oil producer, announced plans to ban palm oil exports from April 28 amid a record rise in global food inflation. President Joko Widodo said he wanted to ensure that the availability of cooking oil was "abundant" and "affordable" in Indonesia. As per Solvent Extractors' Association Of India (SEA), this will hurt Indian consumers.

244.title: Alia & Ranbir's first pic together from a screen test 18 years ago goes viral
244.article_body: After Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor got married, a picture of the couple from 18 years ago has gone viral online. The black-and-white picture is reportedly their first together and was taken during a screen test when Alia was 11 and Ranbir was around 20 years old. The couple has reportedly made the framed picture a part of their home.

245.title: How about declaring April 24 as National Cricket Day: Kaif on Sachin's birthday
245.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif took to Twitter to wish Sachin Tendulkar on his 49th birthday. He wrote, "How about declaring April 24 as National Cricket Day. I have never seen anybody so madly in love with the game like Sachin Paaji." He added, "Happy Birthday to the man who played a big role in India's amar prem with cricket."

246.title: Just like there was one Lata didi, there's one Remo D'Souza: Asha Bhosle
246.article_body: Singer Asha Bhosle made a guest appearance on dance reality show 'Dance India Dance L'il Masters'. She said, "I've been a huge fan of Remo (D'Souza)...I'm so glad [I got] this opportunity to meet my favorite choreographer." She further said that just like there was only one Lata Mangeshkar, there is just one dancer in the industry and that's Remo.

247.title: Indian oil firms saw 3.6 lakh cyberattacks in 6 months: Study
247.article_body: Indian oil companies faced 3.6 lakh cyberattacks between October 2021 and April 12, a study by civil society organisation CyberPeace Foundation revealed. One of the most recent and noticeable among these attacks was detected at Oil India Limited's (OIL) Assam headquarters this month, in which hackers reportedly demanded ₹57 crore. October saw the highest number of attacks at 1,17,633.

248.title: No, I was not named after Urmila's character in 'Judaai': Janhvi
248.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor told Filmfare that her parents, Boney Kapoor and late Sridevi Kapoor, didn't name her after actress Urmila Matondkar's character in 'Judaai'. "I think dad just really liked the name from before the film and mom did too," said Janhvi. "I think mom was really obsessed with the idea that the meaning of it was purity," she added.

249.title: You won't face problems your parents faced: PM to Kashmiri youth
249.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba on Sunday assured the youth that they won't face problems their parents witnessed. "The youth of the Valley, your father and mother, your dada and dadi...lived a life of trouble...you won't live such a life," he said. PM Modi inaugurated and laid foundation stones of projects worth around ₹20,000 crore.

250.title: Bayern Munich win 10th straight Bundesliga title after beating Dortmund
250.article_body: Bayern Munich defeated Borussia Dortmund 3-1 on Saturday to win their 10th consecutive Bundesliga title. They have accumulated 75 points on the Bundesliga points table with 24 victories, three draws and four losses. They won the title with three matches to spare. Bayern Munich have now won 32 German top-flight championships.

251.title: Amber is terrible, she used womanhood to play victim: Ireland Baldwin
251.article_body: Actor Alec Baldwin's daughter Ireland Baldwin took to Instagram and defended Johnny Depp amid his ongoing defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. Reacting to the audio note played in the court in which Heard admitted to hitting Johnny, Ireland wrote, "I know women who are...like this. They're manipulative...they use their very womanhood to play the victim...Heard is a terrible person."

252.title: PM urges people to try 'Cashless Day Out' using only digital mode for payments
252.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has urged people to try a 'Cashless Day Out' by using only digital mode for payments. He gave an example of two girls from Delhi who spent an entire day roaming the city without doing any money transactions in cash. He said that people in small towns and in most villages are also transacting through UPI itself.

253.title: Felt humiliated when Hindi films shown as Indian cinema: Chiranjeevi
253.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi recalled an incident that took place when he was called to New Delhi after his 1988 film 'Rudra Veena' was being honoured with the Nargis Dutt Award. He stated that Hindi cinema was portrayed as Indian cinema. "I felt very humiliated...It was like an insult...other films were categorised as 'regional films' and were not given respect," he added.

254.title: UN chief Guterres to visit Turkey ahead of Moscow, Kyiv trips
254.article_body: UN chief Antonio Guterres will visit Turkey's capital Ankara on Monday before heading onward to Moscow and Kyiv next week for talks, a UN statement said on Saturday. Guterres' visit to Turkey comes as the country seeks to mediate the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. Notably, a negotiation meeting between Russian and Ukrainian delegations was also held in Turkey last month.

255.title: Kolkata Police constable arrested for molesting minor girl in auto-rickshaw
255.article_body: A police constable has been arrested for allegedly molesting a minor girl in Kolkata. According to the girl's mother, the accused constable touched her daughter inappropriately while travelling in an auto-rickshaw. The woman claimed that when her daughter told her about the incident, she asked the auto-rickshaw driver to go to the nearest police station. The driver did as told.

256.title: Priest who threatened to rape Muslim women gets bail, says 'feel no guilt'
256.article_body: Sitapur priest, Bajrang Muni Das, who had threatened to rape Muslim women and was arrested for his remarks, has been granted bail. "I do not feel any guilt. What I said was for my religion and our women. I am willing to give up my life for my religion," the priest said after being granted bail.

257.title: BJP-AGP alliance wins 58 of 60 seats in Guwahati civic body polls; PM thanks voters
257.article_body: The BJP along with its ally Asom Gana Parishad (AGP) won 58 out of the total 60 seats in Assam's Guwahati Municipal Corporation (GMC) elections. While the BJP won in 52 wards, the AGP secured six wards. BJP had already won in three wards unopposed. PM Narendra Modi thanked voters of Guwahati for giving a "resounding mandate" to the party.

258.title: Woman falls into 100-ft-deep gorge after bees attack her at Rajgad Fort
258.article_body: A 28-year-old woman was injured as she fell into a 100-foot-deep gorge off a cliff at Pune's Rajgad Fort after being attacked by bees. The woman was rescued by some trekkers and is undergoing treatment for head injury and fractures. The woman, who is an engineer, had come to the fort with her husband and another family member.

259.title: Playing men in uniform has a special significance: Ajay Devgn
259.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn has revealed that he has always been drawn to men in uniform, adding that uniforms have a special significance. The actor has portrayed policemen in 'Gangaajal' and 'Singham' and will portray a pilot in upcoming film 'Runway 34'. "A pilot is...a demi-God for the passengers who repose blind faith in [them] while they fly," Ajay stated.

260.title: Thar wasn't only shot in the desert; we've gone to small villages too: Anil
260.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor said his film 'Thar' has not only been shot in the desert but they've covered local areas too. "We have gone to small villages and also went shooting in and around old structures," he added. "I never knew Rajasthan is such a happening and beautiful place which has such varied, wonderful locations to be shot," Anil said.

261.title: Aditya Narayan shares first family pic with wife, 2-month-old daughter
261.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan on Sunday took to social media to share the first family picture with wife Shweta Agarwal and daughter Tvisha Narayan Jha. Tvisha's face is not visible in the picture. Aditya wrote in the caption, "Two months ago our little bundle of joy, Tvisha, came into this world." The couple welcomed their baby girl on February 24.

262.title: 'How I Met...' actor Joe Manganiello joins Samuel L Jackson in 'The Kill Room'
262.article_body: Actor Joe Manganiello, who appeared as Brad in the American sitcom 'How I Met Your Mother', is set to star in 'The Kill Room', an upcoming comedy crime thriller that will also feature Samuel L. Jackson and Uma Thurman. It'll be directed by Nicol Paone, who helmed the comedy-drama 'Friendsgiving'. 'The Kill Room' is written by Jonathan Jacobson.

263.title: CBSE drops 'Democracy & Diversity', poems by Faiz from school syllabus: Report
263.article_body: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has dropped chapters on 'Democracy and Diversity', the chronicles of Mughal courts, among other topics from the school syllabus this year, PTI reported. Translated excerpts from two Urdu poems by Faiz Ahmed Faiz have also reportedly been excluded. As per officials, the changes are aligned with NCERT recommendations, reported PTI.

264.title: 1st met her as formality to stop mom from setting me up: Vivek on wife Priyanka
264.article_body: Actor Vivek Oberoi said he first met his wife Priyanka Alva as formality to stop his mom from setting him up. “And I went and I met her...and for the first time I saw somebody who...had no mask, no makeup,” he said. He added that before he met Priyanka, his experience with love had made him “cynical and very bitter”.

265.title: 6 Shiv Sena workers arrested for ruckus outside Maha BJP MP's house
265.article_body: The Khar Police on Sunday arrested six Shiv Sena workers for allegedly creating a ruckus outside BJP MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana's residence in Mumbai. This comes after hundreds of Shiv Sena workers protested outside the couple's house on Saturday after the latter declared to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's house in Mumbai.

266.title: Gurugram Police arrests 4 who threw chilli powder, stole ₹1 cr
266.article_body: Gurugram Police arrested four out of five robbers, who robbed a cash van of around ₹1 crore a week back, an official said on Sunday. The accused threw chilli powder at the guard, van driver and held them hostage before escaping with the money on April 18. Police have recovered the car and most of the cash from the accused.

267.title: Gurugram civic body to outsource running of 16 community centres
267.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) plans to outsource the running of 16 community centres to private agencies on a trial basis from next month. The move is aimed at providing "better services to the public", an official said. The MCG will set a cap on the rates being charged for services at the centres, the official added.

268.title: WHO confirms one child has died in mystery liver disease outbreak
268.article_body: The WHO confirmed at least one death in connection with a mysterious liver disease outbreak affecting children in Europe and the US. "As of April 21, at least 169 cases of acute hepatitis of unknown origin have been reported from 11 countries," WHO said. "Cases are aged 1 month to 16 years old. Seventeen children required liver transplantation," WHO added.

269.title: Johar pens poem on 'Rocky Aur Rani...' cast, calls Alia 'box office ki maharani'
269.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, taking to Instagram on Sunday, penned a poem praising the cast of his upcoming movie 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. In the poem, Johar called actress Alia Bhatt "box office ki maharani". At the end of his poem, he announced that 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' will release on February 10 next year.

270.title: My god, people are crazy: Singer Sunitha reacts on her pregnancy rumours
270.article_body: Singer Sunitha dismissed the rumours of her being pregnant. This came after she posted a picture holding a mango and that caused rumours of the singer expecting a child with her husband. Taking to Instagram, Sunitha wrote, "My god...people are crazy...I posted a picture today with my first mango crop and the news spreads like this. Stop assuming things."

271.title: Anupam Kher shares his before-after pic, says 'Face has changed but fire in eyes is same'
271.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a before-after picture of himself. He wrote, "Face has changed. But the fire and the hunger in the eyes is the same!" He added, "The pic on the left is from a portfolio shoot I did when I came to the #CityOfDreams, Mumbai, in 1981." "So inspiring journey," a user commented.

272.title: Sehwag shares video of him eating banana as birthday gift to Sachin Tendulkar
272.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to wish Sachin Tendulkar on his 49th birthday. Sehwag shared a video, wherein he revealed that Sachin always expected him to be quiet in the dressing room during matches. "Sachin used to feed me bananas so that I kept quiet," he said. "I won't say anything today, I will eat bananas," he added.

273.title: It's overwhelming when I see a meme about Munna Bhaiya: Divyenndu
273.article_body: Speaking about his character 'Munna Bhaiya' in 'Mirzapur,' actor Divyenndu Sharma said it's overwhelming to see people still love the character so much. "Mirzapur 2 was released...long time back but still every day on social media, I see a...meme or reel about Munna Bhaiya," he added.  "People actually believe that in some parallel universe...[Munna Tripathi] really exists," he said.

274.title: Destroyed Odesa depot where foreign weapons were stored: Russia
274.article_body: Russia has claimed that it destroyed a logistics terminal in Ukraine's Odesa where a huge cache of weapons from foreign countries were stored. It said that weapons from the US and European countries were destroyed using high-precision missiles. It further said that up to 200 Ukrainian soldiers were killed and over 30 vehicles were destroyed on Saturday.

275.title: Auto-rickshaw driver abuses woman for not cancelling ride in Gurugram
275.article_body: Gurugram Police booked an Ola auto-rickshaw driver for allegedly misbehaving with a woman passenger and abusing her for not cancelling the ride, officials said on Saturday. The woman alleged that she tried contacting Ola support, but it showed that they had already resolved the matter without a follow-up. Officials said they let the driver off on police bail.

276.title: Minor says she wants to leave past baggage, Bombay HC quashes FIR against rape accused
276.article_body: Bombay High Court has quashed an FIR against a 20-year-old man from Pune, accused of raping a minor girl. The survivor said that as she wishes to pursue further studies, the pendency of criminal proceedings will be a hurdle and she wants to "leave behind the baggage of the past" and concentrate on the "positive side for a better future".

277.title: Had traumatic experience with close family at 6, turned extreme: Munawar
277.article_body: In a promo shared by ALTBalaji for reality show 'Lock Upp', contestant Munawar Faruqui recounted his traumatic experience involving close family at age six. He said he didn't understand it at the time and it continued for four-five years but turned extreme in the fourth year. "I've never shared this with anyone because I have to face them," Munawar said.

278.title: Ashish Mishra surrenders after SC rejects bail in Lakhimpur case; sent back to jail
278.article_body: Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni's son Ashish Mishra, who is accused of killing farmers in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri last year, on Sunday surrendered before police and was sent back to prison. The Supreme Court had last week cancelled his bail and given him a week to surrender. Ashish was granted bail by Allahabad High Court in February this year.

279.title: 'Mirzapur' script didn't allow me to explore my character: Shriya Pilgaonkar
279.article_body: Actress Shriya Pilgaonkar, who played a character named Sweety Gupta in 'Mirzapur', has said the web show's script didn't allow her to explore her character. "Although I love my character in 'Mirzapur', there was a lot I could do as Sweety Gupta," she added. Shriya's character died in the finale episode of Mirzapur's inaugural season.

280.title: Russian opposition activist jailed for denouncing war in Ukraine
280.article_body: Russia has placed an activist accused of maligning country’s armed forces in pre-trial detention till June. Vladimir Kara-Murza Jr. was charged for a speech he made to Arizona House of Representatives, wherein he denounced Ukraine's invasion, his lawyer claimed. Russia recently adopted law criminalising spread of "fake" news about its armed forces with jail term of up to 15 years.

281.title: Motivating to grab eyeballs even before my work is out: Rashmika
281.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna has stated that it feels super motivating to grab eyeballs even before her work has come out. "I don't want to look at it as pressure because from what I've seen from the North, they're all...amazing," she added. Rashmika has 'Mission Majnu' with Sidharth Malhotra, 'Goodbye' with Amitabh Bachchan and 'Animal' with Ranbir Kapoor in the pipeline.

282.title: There's a difference in his bowling, he's not bowling with seam: RP Singh on Siraj
282.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said there's a difference in Mohammed Siraj's bowling this season. "In the earlier seasons, Siraj used to hit the deck with seam, extracting a good bounce from the surface. Now, you don't see him bowling with the seam...He needs to go back to his basics," explained Singh. Siraj has picked six wickets in eight games.

283.title: FPIs, net sellers since Oct, withdraw ₹12,286 cr between Apr 1-22
283.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹12,286 crore between April 1-22, data with depositories showed. FPIs had withdrawn ₹1.48 lakh crore between October 2021 and March 2022 and became net investors between April 1-8, for the first time in six months, by investing net ₹7,707 crore. They have been net sellers since then, withdrawing ₹4,500 crore between April 11-13.

284.title: Makeup Amber 'used to hide bruises by Depp' launched after their divorce: Milani
284.article_body: Actress Amber Heard had claimed she carried Milani's All-In-One Correcting Kit with her to cover up bruises she allegedly received from her husband Johnny Depp. The makeup brand, however, claimed the product wasn't launched until after the couple divorced in 2016. Milani Cosmetics said the kit, presented during Depp's defamation suit trial against Heard, was launched in December 2017.

285.title: Punishment doesn't fit crime: Terry Crews on Will slapping Chris
285.article_body: Actor Terry Crews has lent support for Will Smith in the 2022 Oscars slap incident involving Chris Rock, saying that the punishment does not fit the crime. Will has been banned from the Academy for ten years for slapping Chris. "I love them both as brothers but there was a time...I was Will Smith...and...I've done worse than Will," Terry said.

286.title: The OG ladykiller: Arjun Kapoor shares fan's post featuring his throwback pics
286.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor shared a fan's post featuring his old pictures, as he started shooting for his new film 'The Lady Killer'. Taking to Instagram Stories, Arjun posted the collage of his throwback pictures which showed the actor with long hair and dressed in different outfits. Sharing the post, Arjun wrote, "The OG ladykiller."

287.title: Don't know why MI didn't go back to Marco Jansen: SRH batting coach Lara
287.article_body: Following a nine-wicket win over RCB, SRH batting coach Brian Lara praised pacer Marco Jansen who scalped three wickets in the match. "I don't know why Mumbai [Indians] didn't go back to Jansen. He is an awesome talent," Lara said. Jansen, who was part of MI in IPL 2021, was bought by SRH for ₹4.2 crore in the mega auction.

288.title: We're making sure players understand their roles: Moody on SRH's 5th win
288.article_body: SRH head coach Tom Moody has said role clarity is one of the reasons for their five-match winning streak in IPL 2022. "We make sure that players [understand] their roles...and when they are called upon in certain stages [they deliver]," he stated. "We're very specific in our training as to where we are playing, who the opposition is," Moody added.

289.title: Priest stabbed multiple times, nun hurt in France church
289.article_body: A priest was reportedly stabbed multiple times in a church in France's Nice on Sunday. A nun, who tried to snatch the knife from the attacker, was hurt in the arm. According to Nice mayor Christian Estrosi, the attacker was mentally unstable and had no past criminal record. The 31-year-old attacker has been arrested.

290.title: Neutral faces are not sad faces: Ira on people saying she looks 'very serious'
290.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan’s daughter Ira Khan took to her Instagram Stories to post her selfie, saying people have told her she looks “very serious”."This is my normal face...It's not smiley or happy but it's not unhappy either. I'd say it is pretty neutral," she said, adding, "What I was trying to say is...neutral faces are not sad faces."

291.title: I felt lost all the time: Shamita Shetty on her battle with depression
291.article_body: Actress and 'Bigg Boss 15' contestant Shamita Shetty spoke about overcoming depression on her sister Shilpa Shetty's chat show 'Shape of You'. Shamita said, "When I went through that phase, I didn't even know I was in depression...I felt lost all the time." "I was dating someone at the time and he told me 'there is something wrong'," she added.

292.title: Hardik Pandya is best suited option for Team India at no. 4: Irfan Pathan
292.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has said Gujarat Titans captain Hardik Pandya is the "best suited" option for Team India at the number four position. "This is a new Hardik. This is a better version of him. It was nice to see the situations in which he has played," Irfan added. Hardik is currently the second-highest scorer in IPL 2022.

293.title: MBA grad who was arrested for stealing over 60 cars moved to Hyd from B'luru
293.article_body: An MBA graduate who is accused of stealing over 60 cars was moved to Hyderabad from Bengaluru on a prisoner transit. He was arrested in his hometown Jaipur last month and brought to Bengaluru. In January 2021, he had allegedly stolen a Toyota Fortuner car belonging to Kannada film producer Manjunath from a five-star hotel.

294.title: J&K's Palli becomes India's first carbon neutral panchayat
294.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated a 500 KW solar power plant at Jammu and Kashmir's Palli, making it India's first carbon neutral panchayat. "The people of Palli have demonstrated what 'sabka prayas' (everybody’s efforts) can do," he said. Earlier, Union Minister Jitendra Singh had said that the solar power plant was completed in a record time of 20 days.

295.title: Against whom did Sachin Tendulkar score the most international hundreds?
295.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar, who turns 49 today, scored 100 international hundreds in his career spanning 664 matches. Sachin's most international hundreds came against Australia (20), followed by Sri Lanka (17) and South Africa (12). He slammed nine hundreds each against New Zealand and England. Sachin scored 53 of his 100 hundreds in winning cause. Sachin hit six hundreds in World Cups.

296.title: Rajiv Gandhi introduced Panchayati Raj system, fulfilled Gandhiji’s dream: Rahul
296.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi fulfilled Mahatma Gandhi’s dream of strengthening villages by giving the Panchayati Raj System to the country. "It was Mahatma Gandhi’s dream that the villages of the country should become strong," Rahul Gandhi tweeted on the occasion of the National Panchayati Raj Day.

297.title: Delhi Police crackdown on gang making counterfeit ₹10 coins
297.article_body: Five people were arrested by the Delhi Police on Friday for being involved in making counterfeit ₹10 coins. The main accused, a businessman, was running four units outside the national capital to manufacture the coins and had 500 kg of raw material for the same. The police also seized coins with face value of over ₹10 lakh from the accused.

298.title: Monkey born with 'Batman' symbol on face in US zoo; pic released
298.article_body: A US zoo has announced the birth of a spider monkey with a 'Batman' symbol on the face. "Keepers were surprised to see the baby's unique markings, noting the resemblance to the Batman symbol," the zoo said. The symbol of a bat extending its wings is used throughout the DC Comics as a distress signal to summon the superhero Batman.

299.title: Tiger recreates 'choti bacchi ho kya' dialogue at event after memes go viral
299.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff recreated the "choti bacchi ho kya" dialogue from his debut film 'Heropanti' during a recent event, days after memes using the dialogue went viral on social media. The actor recreated the dialogue during an event for his upcoming film, 'Heropanti 2'. Several social media users reacted to Tiger's video, with one tweeting, "Finally from the legend himself."

300.title: Billionaire Jack Dorsey drops his CEO title at Block, calls himself 'Block Head'
300.article_body: Twitter's billionaire Co-founder Jack Dorsey, who Co-founded fintech startup Block (previously Square), has changed his title of CEO at Block to 'Block Head and Chairperson'. "There will be no changes in Dorsey's roles and responsibilities," Block said in a regulatory filing. World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted to Dorsey, "Your new title at Block is...," followed by two fire emojis.

301.title: Black-coloured horse bought for ₹23 lakh in Punjab turns brown on being washed
301.article_body: A man in Punjab was cheated out of ₹22.65 lakh by a trader who sold him a black-coloured horse claiming it's a highly sought-after and rare breed from the Marwar region. The alleged victim Ramesh Singh said it turned reddish-brown after he gave it a bath. Police have filed a case of fraud against three people.

302.title: India seeing digital transactions worth ₹20,000 cr daily: PM
302.article_body: PM Narendra Modi in his 'Mann Ki Baat' radio programme on Sunday said digital transactions worth ₹20,000 crore are now taking place daily in the country. "In March, UPI transactions even reached ₹10 lakh crore," PM Modi stated. He urged the public to go for 'Cashless Day Out', adding that digital transactions boost facilities and encourage honesty.

303.title: Tata Motors also hikes vehicle prices after Maruti Suzuki
303.article_body: Tata Motors on Saturday said it has hiked the prices of its passenger vehicles by an average of 1.1% with immediate effect to partially offset the rise in input cost. This comes after Maruti Suzuki increased the prices of all its models by 1.3% on April 18. Last month, Tata Motors announced a 2-2.5% price hike on commercial vehicles.

304.title: If you're snooty & don't reach out for work, it's end of road: Aparshakti
304.article_body: Actor Aparshakti Khurana has stated that reaching out to relevant people for work is a very regular process. "If you become a snob or snooty, that's the end of the road for you," he added. He said you don't need to chase the world beyond a point but have to make time for people who want to work with you.

305.title: Real estate agent rapes 24-yr-old hairdresser in Pune, arrested
305.article_body: Police have arrested a real estate agent for allegedly raping a 24-year-old hairdresser when she had gone to see a house in Pune, an official said on Sunday. On Friday night, the accused called the woman to see a house and took her to his residence, where he raped her and recorded the act, police said.

306.title: GHMC to set up 53 theme parks in Hyderabad to improve green cover
306.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) will set up as many as 53 new theme parks in the city to improve its green cover. Civil works are reportedly in progress in 25 of these upcoming spaces, while the development of the remaining parks is under various stages of implementation. Notably, these spaces will include exclusive play areas for children.

307.title: Ronaldo points to the sky after scoring goal vs Arsenal, dedicates it to late baby son
307.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo dedicated his goal against Arsenal on Saturday to his late baby son. After scoring in the 34th minute, Ronaldo looked towards the sky and pointed towards it as a tribute to his late baby son. Ronaldo also took to Instagram to share a picture and posted a heart emoji in the caption.

308.title: Man tries to murder woman who accused him of rape in Bengaluru
308.article_body: A case has been filed after a man, who was out on bail, and his two associates allegedly tried to murder a 41-year-old woman who had previously accused him of rape. The trio was reportedly trying to pressurise the woman to not file objections against the man's plea to get the rape case quashed. The incident occurred on April 19.

309.title: AAP welcomes Kerala officials at Delhi school; Kerala govt denies sending anyone
309.article_body: After AAP MLA Atishi welcomed Kerala officials at a Delhi government school and said they wanted to replicate the model in their state, Kerala Education Minister V Sivankutty said the state government hadn't sent anyone to Delhi. "At the same time, all assistance was provided to officials who had visited from Delhi to study 'Kerala Model' last month," Sivankutty added.

310.title: Madhya Pradesh CM announces ₹1 cr for family of personnel who died in J&K
310.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has announced relief of ₹1 crore for the family of Assistant Sub-Inspector Shankar Prasad Patel, who lost his life in Jammu and Kashmir on Friday. Chouhan has also promised a government job to a family member of security personnel. The state government will also name an institution after him as a tribute.

311.title: KKR is looking like a team who don't have an idea whom to play: Aakash
311.article_body: Aakash Chopra said KKR made a lot of changes going into the match against Gujarat Titans. "Kolkata is looking like a team who don't have an idea whom to play...they've...played four different opening pairs in eight matches," he stated. Aaron Finch, Sheldon Jackson and Pat Cummins were replaced by Sam Billings, Rinku Singh and Tim Southee against Gujarat Titans.

312.title: Muslim neighbours help family with Hindu woman's last rites in Mysuru
312.article_body: Realising that there were not many attendees, Muslim neighbours of a Hindu woman helped her family with her last rites in Karnataka's Mysuru. "Hers was only Hindu family here, but we all shared a great bond...When we heard about her sudden demise, we were shocked...least we could do was to lend our shoulder to carry the bier," a neighbour said.

313.title: IMF assures support to Sri Lanka in overcoming economic crisis
313.article_body: International Monetary Fund (IMF) has assured its support to the Sri Lankan government in overcoming the country's ongoing economic crisis. It termed the meeting with Sri Lankan Finance Minister Ali Sabry and Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe as "fruitful". IMF said its team will work closely with authorities on their economic programme and engage with stakeholders to resolve the crisis.

314.title: Shifting down the batting order may just free Rohit Sharma up: Vettori
314.article_body: Ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said that Rohit Sharma should consider batting down the order for Mumbai Indians to "free him up". "Rohit opens for India...it's hard to put yourself down the order in these situations. But after the season they've had, it might be the right answer," he added. Rohit has scored 114 runs in 7 matches so far.

315.title: MPSC aspirant attacked with cement block by 3 phone robbers in Pune
315.article_body: A 28-year-old man, who is preparing for Maharashtra Public Service Commission exam, was allegedly chased and attacked with a cement block by three mobile phone robbers in Chinchwad area. The man received a serious injury on the right side of his head and is hospitalised. The incident took place when he had gone to purchase some books for MPSC exam.

316.title: I'm honoured to be Karan Johar's leading man: Ranveer on 'Rocky Aur Rani...'
316.article_body: Ranveer Singh, who'll be seen in Karan Johar's upcoming directorial titled 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', said, "I'm honoured to be [Karan's] leading man." "He's made cult films that we have grown up on. It's a Karan Johar romantic family dramedy, a genre that he's full ownership of," he added. The film also stars Alia Bhatt and Shabana Azmi.

317.title: 7 from Sri Lanka among 143 officers graduated from Pune's military institute
317.article_body: As many as 143 military officers, including seven from Sri Lanka, graduated from Pune-based Military Institute of Technology (MILIT) after completing the Defence Services Technical Staff Course. Air Marshal BR Krishna stressed on the need to absorb and apply cutting edge technologies in the armed forces. He also advised the officers to utilise the knowledge in their assignments in future.

318.title: JMM leader shot dead in Jharkhand’s Latehar
318.article_body: Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) leader Dileshwar Khan was shot dead by unidentified persons on Sunday at Kusumahi railway siding in Latehar district. Based on the information collected so far, the police said that the victim, JMM Balumath block president, was attacked by six persons on two motorbikes. Khan was taken to a hospital where he was declared dead.

319.title: OTT gave me a new lease of life: Family Man & Scam 1992 actor Sharib
319.article_body: Sharib Hashmi, known for shows like 'The Family Man' and 'Scam 1992: The Harshad Mehta Story', said, "OTT gave me a new lease of life because my career was going through a rough patch...for a while." "Though I...[signed] a few films post 'Filmistaan', things didn't work out the way I [imagined]...and then I got Family Man, Scam 1992," he added.

320.title: Messi scores as PSG win record-equalling 10th Ligue 1 title with 4 matches to spare
320.article_body: Argentine forward Lionel Messi scored a 25-metre goal as PSG drew 1-1 against Lens to win their record equalling 10th Ligue 1 title. PSG equalled Marseille and Saint-Etienne's record for winning 10 French top-flight championships. PSG won the title with four league matches remaining in the season. PSG are on top of the table with 78 points from 34 matches.

321.title: T Natarajan wants to be on flight to Australia for WC: Gavaskar
321.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that SRH pacer T Natarajan, who's currently the second-highest wicket-taker in the ongoing IPL season, is bowling with full confidence in the tournament. "He recognises that there is a World Cup coming up, he wants to be on that flight to Australia," Gavaskar added. Natarajan registered figures of 3-0-10-3 against RCB.

322.title: Hyderabad Police avert child marriage bid, rescue minor girl
322.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police along with District Child Protection Officials averted a child marriage bid and rescued a minor girl in Kandukur Mandal on Saturday. The wedding, which was supposed to take place next week, was called off after police counselled the families. Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat also shared a WhatsApp number through which citizens can report child marriages.

323.title: Ajit Pawar sanctions ₹1.5 cr for planned Pune leopard safari report
323.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar on Saturday sanctioned ₹1.5 crore for the preparation of a detailed project report on the planned leopard safari in Pune's Junnar. This comes as Pawar inaugurated the multispecialty hospital dedicated to wildlife animals in Manikdoh on the same day. Pawar said that the proposed leopard safari would also create job opportunities for local people.

324.title: Google adds 'reject all cookies' option in Europe after €150 mn fine
324.article_body: Google is introducing a single-click "reject all" option for cookies in Europe after France's data protection agency fined Google €150 million for confusing language in cookie banners. The option's rollout began from Google-owned YouTube in France and will soon be expanded across Europe on Google's search engine and YouTube. Cookies help websites keep track of a user's visits and activities.

325.title: It's everybody's dream to direct Big B, you can't talk about him casually: Ajay
325.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said that it is everybody's dream to direct actor Amitabh Bachchan. "His kind of performance, the kind of dedication he puts in, is worthwhile. He's director's actor. He inspires you completely. He is someone you cannot talk about casually. He is a legend," he said, adding, "I have known him...since childhood...there wasn't any pressure [while directing him]."

326.title: Manish Sisodia inaugurates south Delhi's Ashram underpass
326.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Sunday inaugurated the Ashram underpass in south Delhi. Sisodia said the underpass will not only save commuters' time, but also save nearly 1,550 litres of fuel and 3,600 kg of carbon emissions daily. The four-lane, 750-metre-long underpass connects Nizamuddin with New Friends Colony and aims at providing a signal-free ride between Nizamuddin and Badarpur.

327.title: Police to take action against those found guilty: Maha HM over 'attack' on Somaiya
327.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil on Sunday said that a probe is underway into the alleged attack on BJP leader Kirit Somaiya by Shiv Sena workers. "It's true there was stone-pelting…Police will take appropriate action against those found guilty. A case has been registered in the matter," Patil added. Somaiya alleged that Shiv Sena "gundas" assaulted him with stones.

328.title: India has suspended Chinese nationals' tourist visas: Global airlines body
328.article_body: The Indian government has suspended tourist visas issued to Chinese nationals, global airlines body IATA had told its members on April 20. This came after China refused to allow around 22,000 Indian students enrolled in Chinese universities to enter, despite India's appeals. India has requested China to take a "congenial stance" on the issue, MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi had said.

329.title: Stayed in a very small room with owner's dog for 9 months: Actress Pia on struggling days
329.article_body: Talking about her struggling days, actress Pia Bajpiee revealed when she came to Mumbai, she couldn't get a place to stay initially. "The owner of an apartment...asked me if I was ready to manage in a very small room where she used to keep her dog," Pia added. She stated, "I stayed there for over nine months with that dog."

330.title: PM Modi inaugurates developmental projects worth over ₹20,000 crore in J&K
330.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, during his visit to Palli village of Jammu and Kashmir's Samba, inaugurated several developmental projects worth over ₹20,000 crore in the Union Territory. The PM laid the foundation stone of Delhi-Amritsar-Katra Expressway and inaugurated a 500 kW solar power plant, along with 108 Jan Aushadhi Kendras. "Our aim is to provide all-weather connectivity to J&K," he said.

331.title: We've same choices: Sayani on twinning with Tamannaah Bhatia at an Iftaar party
331.article_body: Recalling her experience of co-incidentally twinning with actress Tamannaah Bhatia at an Iftaar party, actress Sayani Gupta said, "When we saw that we were wearing the same outfit, it actually added to the fun and joy of meeting each other." "We both were happy that we've...same choices and aesthetics. And our chat wasn't about what we were wearing," she added.

332.title: Be it democracy or development, J&K is setting example: PM Modi
332.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday hailed the development work done in Jammu and Kashmir in the last two to three years. "Be it democracy or development, today Jammu and Kashmir is setting a new example," Modi said, addressing the public in Jammu on National Panchayati Raj Day. Many private investors are interested in coming to J&K, he added.

333.title: Chanting Hanuman Chalisa in Shiv Sena-ruled Maha is a crime: CT Ravi
333.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party leader CT Ravi took to Twitter to say that it is a crime to chant Hanuman Chalisa in Shiv Sena-ruled Maharashtra. "People will be arrested for this crime by Uddhav Thackeray's police. Who said that Aurangzeb is dead!" he wrote. His tweet came after arrest of MP Navneet Rana and her MLA husband Ravi Rana.

334.title: Tour boat hits 'whale', leaps out of water in Mexico; 6 injured
334.article_body: At least six people, including three children, were injured after a tour boat hit something and leapt out of the water in the coastal city of La Paz in Mexico's Baja California Sur, authorities said on Saturday. The authorities added that the boat reportedly hit a whale or a whale shark. A video of the incident was also shared online.

335.title: PM's 'Mann Ki Baat' to be shown every last Sunday at Gandhi Darshan: Vijay Goel
335.article_body: PM Narendra Modi’s monthly radio programme 'Mann Ki Baat' will be shown every last Sunday of the month at Gandhi Darshan in Delhi’s Raj Ghat, Vice-Chairman, Gandhi Smriti, Vijay Goel, said on Saturday. "Tomorrow (Sunday), more than 1,000 residents of slums will come to Gandhi Darshan to watch this programme," Goel tweeted.

336.title: We keep talking about the way we need to play: Abhishek on batting with Kane
336.article_body: SRH's 21-year-old opener Abhishek Sharma, who has scored 220 runs in seven games this IPL season so far, has revealed that captain Kane Williamson talks to him on almost every ball while batting about the way they need to play the game. "Learning a lot from [batting coach] Brian Lara," he added. Abhishek scored 47(28) against RCB on Saturday.

337.title: 4 men arrested for murder of BJP worker in Delhi's Mayur Vihar Phase 3
337.article_body: Days after a BJP worker was shot dead outside his house in Delhi's Mayur Vihar Phase 3, police said they have arrested four men in connection with the crime based on CCTV footage. According to police, the accused, who lived near the victim's house, wanted to take revenge on him. The victim's body was found with five bullet wounds.

338.title: I haven't understood who won what in Takeshi’s Castle till today: Jaaved Jaaferi
338.article_body: Actor Jaaved Jaaferi said till today, he has not understood who won what in the show 'Takeshi's Castle'. "A lot of people...an entire generation grew up on Takeshi's Castle...They want me to do this show. There is...relationship with the show...I would love to do it," he said, adding, "When I meet people...they thank me for bringing that show to them."

339.title: Lucky to be your baby sister: Bella shares childhood pics with Gigi on b'day
339.article_body: American model Bella Hadid on Saturday wished her sister-model Gigi Hadid on her 27th birthday. Sharing a few childhood pictures on her Instagram handle, Bella wrote, "Thank you for being born so that I could be born that was very sweet of you." "Thank you for being...best sister, mom, daughter...ever...I feel so lucky to be your baby sister," she added.

340.title: 9 of 26 onboard missing Japan boat found unconscious: Coast guard
340.article_body: Nine of the 26 people, including two children and two crew members, onboard a sightseeing boat that went missing off the coast of Japan have been found unconscious on Sunday, a coast guard official told Reuters. The official said that it wasn't immediately clear if the people had vital signs. The nine people were reportedly taken to a hospital.

341.title: MS Dhoni, teammates dance during Conway's pre-wedding party, CSK share video
341.article_body: CSK took to social media to share a video of their players dancing during batter Devon Conway's pre-wedding party. The video also features MS Dhoni dancing during the party. All-rounder Dwayne Bravo can be seen doing the dance steps of his song 'Number One' with leg-spinner Prashant Solanki. Conway has left the bio-bubble for his wedding.

342.title: Woman constable carries 86-year-old for 5 km in Gujarat’s Kutch desert
342.article_body: A 27-year-old police constable, Varsha Parmar, lifted an 86-year-old woman on her back and walked for five kilometres under the sun in the white desert of Gujarat's Kutch. The elderly woman had fainted due to sunstroke. Parmar said that she helped the woman for humanity and had no intention of becoming famous after a video of the incident surfaced online.

343.title: Daily COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru rise by 169% in 7 days to 132
343.article_body: The number of daily coronavirus cases in Bengaluru has increased by over 169% in seven days as the city reported 132 cases on Saturday, according to official data. The city had reported 49 new cases on April 17, data showed. The positivity rate in the city on Saturday was 3.4% and the active cases reported were 1,601, data also revealed.

344.title: Charge less money, do more acting: Karan Johar on Varun Dhawan's b'day
344.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar wished Varun Dhawan on his birthday. Sharing a throwback photo featuring himself and Varun where Karan is seen kissing the actor as he held him, he wrote, "Let's get some publicity and wish you as well. Happy Birthday Varun aka Kuku. Live for a thousand years. Create commotion at...box office, charge less money [and] do more acting."

345.title: IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi shares pic from her wedding with IAS officer Gawande
345.article_body: IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi took to Twitter to share a new profile picture from her wedding with Dr Pradeep Gawande, a 2013-batch IAS officer. In the photo, the couple can be seen sitting on a couch, while donning a matching white outfit. The duo got married on Wednesday in Rajasthan's capital Jaipur.

346.title: Doctors remove cloth from abdomen of 25-yr-old woman at Thane hospital
346.article_body: Doctors of the Central Hospital in Thane's Ulhasnagar successfully performed a surgery and removed a piece of cloth from the abdomen of a 25-year-old woman. The woman reportedly underwent a maternity surgery at a private hospital in October last year, during which the cloth was left inside her abdomen. A complaint was registered against the private hospital for medical negligence.

347.title: Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya becoming centre of attraction for youth: PM
347.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the recently-inaugurated 'Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya' is becoming the centre of attraction for the youth, which is connecting them with the precious heritage of the country. "The country has got a Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya...It's a matter of pride that we are remembering the contribution of PMs," PM Modi added.

348.title: Rape accused out on bail kidnaps victim's brother, blackmails Kota family
348.article_body: Kota Police arrested a 23-year-old rape accused who was out on bail after he kidnapped survivor's minor brother to blackmail family. Police said that accused, Ronak Dhobi told family that their son was in his custody and he would let him go if they withdrew case against him. Dhobi was earlier arrested a year ago for raping boy's elder sister.

349.title: Panchayats are pillars of Indian democracy: PM Modi
349.article_body: On the occasion of National Panchayati Raj Day, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the panchayats are the pillars of the Indian democracy. "Wishing you all a very happy National Panchayati Raj Day. Panchayats are the pillars of Indian democracy, in whose strength lies the prosperity of the new India," PM Modi tweeted.

350.title: Man stabs TN Police sub-inspector over month-old fine for drunk driving
350.article_body: A female Tamil Nadu Police sub-inspector was injured after she was stabbed by a man while on duty in Tirunelveli. Police reportedly claimed the accused was enraged as the sub-inspector had booked him one month ago for drunk driving. The accused has been arrested, CM MK Stalin said, adding that he has ordered a high-quality medical treatment for the sub-inspector.
