351.title: It's the best spell I've bowled with white ball so far: Jansen on 3/25 vs RCB
351.article_body: SRH pacer Marco Jansen has said that his spell against RCB on Saturday was his best with the white ball so far. Jansen dismissed Faf Du Plessis, Virat Kohli and Anuj Rawat in his first over to reduce RCB to 8/3 after two overs in their match. "I enjoyed the third wicket the most (Anuj Rawat's wicket)," he stated.

352.title: Want Asian countries to change attitude towards Ukraine: Zelenskyy
352.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that he wanted the Asian countries, many of which haven't voted against Russia's attack on various global platforms, to change their attitude. Stating that the European countries first underestimated Ukraine but their attitude changed later, Zelenskyy added, "I very much want the Asian countries to change their attitude to Ukraine as well."

353.title: Voting underway in France to elect new President
353.article_body: Voting is underway on Sunday to elect the new President of France. The contest is between the incumbent, Emmanuel Macron, and candidate Marine Le Pen, after they emerged as the top two contenders in the first round of election held earlier this month. Polling started at 8 am and will continue till 8 pm, as per local time.

354.title: Hindi is no more a national language: Kiccha Sudeep on KGF 2's success
354.article_body: While referring to the success of 'KGF 2', Kannada actor Kiccha Sudeep, in a video, said, "[People say] a pan-India film was made in Kannada...I'd like to make a small correction." He added, "Hindi is no more a national language...They (Bollywood) are doing pan-India films today. They are struggling [to find success] by dubbing in [other languages]...but it’s not happening."

355.title: Centre to mint ₹100 coin to mark Delhi University's centenary year
355.article_body: The Finance Ministry's Economic Affairs Department has issued a gazette notification announcing the minting of a ₹100 coin to commemorate Delhi University's centenary year. The coin will be composed of an alloy containing 50% silver, according to the notification. One coin face will bear the university's logo while the other will have the Lion Capital of Ashoka Pillar, it said.

356.title: Pune policeman sexually assaults woman he met online, shoots her nude videos
356.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a 34-year-old policeman, Vikram Ganpat Fadtare, for sexually assaulting a 30-year-old married woman whom he met on social media. Fadtare allegedly forced the woman to have sexual intercourse with him and shot nude pictures and videos of her with which he used to threaten her. The crime allegedly occurred between September 2021 and February 2022.

357.title: Kerala officials keen to implement our education model in their state: AAP's Atishi
357.article_body: Educationists and dignitaries from Kerala visited a government school in Delhi’s Kalkaji on Saturday to observe the education system there. They were hosted by Kalkaji MLA and AAP leader Atishi. "It was wonderful to host officials from Kerala at one of our schools in Kalkaji. They were keen to understand and implement our education model in their state," Atishi tweeted.

358.title: Not reached wave but hospitalisations lower than Dec-Jan: Delhi official
358.article_body: A senior health official in national capital Delhi said hospital admissions were low during the Omicron wave in December and January and that they are even lower now. "The patients who are in hospitals are those...whose medical condition even without Covid was critical and those...who have died of infection are also those who had serious co-morbid conditions," the official said.

359.title: 'Never Back Down: Revolt' actress Nitu meets Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
359.article_body: Actress Nitu Chandra Srivastava, who made her Hollywood debut last year with 'Never Back Down: Revolt', recently met Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and Minister of Industries Syed Shahnawaz Hussain on a two-day trip to the state. Sharing pictures from his meeting with Nitu, Nitish Kumar wrote, "I congratulated...her...for her performance in a Hollywood film. Wishing Nitu Chandra a bright future."

360.title: Can't address Salman Khan by his name; for me, he'll always be 'sir': Shehnaaz
360.article_body: Actress and ex 'Bigg Boss 13' contestant Shehnaaz Gill said that she likes Salman Khan's confidence and is fascinated by the actor's way to handle situations. Shehnaaz further said that she can never address Salman Khan by his name, and she will always call him "Sir". Salman and Shehnaaz were recently spotted at Baba Siddique's Iftaar party.

361.title: Happy to spend this b'day working, feels great to be up at 5:30 am: Varun
361.article_body: Varun Dhawan, who turned 35 on Sunday, wrote on Instagram, "It ain't my sweet 16, but super happy to spend this birthday working." "The last two birthdays were spent at home but feels great to be out here on set getting up at 5:30 in morning and reporting to Nitesh Tiwari," he added. Varun is shooting for Nitesh's 'Bawaal'.

362.title: 175 arrested over communal clashes in MP's Khargone; curfew relaxed for 9 hrs
362.article_body: A total of 175 people have been arrested so far over communal clashes that took place in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone during Ram Navami celebrations, police said. Local administration relaxed the curfew in Khargone for nine hours – from 8 am to 5 pm – for the second day in a row on Sunday, while night curfew continues to remain imposed.

363.title: Struggled for 15 months; didn't want dad to risk his earnings on my career: Vivek
363.article_body: Speaking about his journey, actor Vivek Oberoi said he struggled for 15 months to make his own mark in Bollywood. Vivek said he went to producers for auditions and stood outside their doors. "I...dropped my last name as I didn't want to use my father's (Suresh Oberoi) name." "I didn't want...dad to [risk] his lifetime's earnings....on my career," he added.

364.title: Not thinking about India comeback, my focus on IPL: Hardik Pandya
364.article_body: Gujarat Titans captain Hardik Pandya, who's currently the second-highest scorer in the ongoing IPL season, has said he's not thinking about his Team India comeback. "At the moment, I'm playing IPL and will focus on IPL, then will see where the future takes," he added. GT are at the top of IPL points table with six wins in seven games.

365.title: MVA govt propagating violence in front of police: Maharashtra BJP chief
365.article_body: After BJP leader Kirit Somaiya claimed that Shiv Sena’s "gundas" assaulted him with stones in presence of police persons, Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil stated that now the MVA government is propagating violence in front of police. "The attack on Kirit Somaiya was not just an attempt to threaten him but to kill him," Patil added.

366.title: 40-yr-old farmer dies by suicide in Punjab; 14th such death in state in April
366.article_body: Depressed over low wheat yield, a 40-year-old farmer allegedly died by suicide in Punjab's Hoshiarpur, police said. Punjab has witnessed 14 farmer suicides in April this year, according to a farmers' union. Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu criticised AAP over its pre-poll promise that no farmer in Punjab would die by suicide due to crop failure after April 1.

367.title: Virat is doing everything that is under his control: RCB coach Bangar
367.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's form after he recorded his second straight golden duck, RCB head coach Sanjay Bangar said the 33-year-old is doing "everything that is under his control". He added, "But then you have an odd run-out or the first edge that finds his bat lands in fielder's hands." Kohli hasn't crossed the 50-run mark in the ongoing season.

368.title: Sachin batted just once on b'day in 24-yr-long int'l career, hit a century on it
368.article_body: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, who turned 49 on Sunday, batted for India on his birthday only once in his 24-year-long career. He scored 134(131) to help India win the ODI tri-series final against Australia in Sharjah on April 24, 1998. "I was tired but I had to give a gift to wife on my birthday," said Sachin after the final.

369.title: Saw Dhoni getting frustrated only once, he kicked his bag a tiny bit: Shane Watson
369.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said he has seen his ex-CSK teammate MS Dhoni getting frustrated only once when CSK lost to MI in IPL 2019 final. "I saw him halfway kick his bag a little bit...just a tiny bit. You could see how much it meant to him," he added. "No matter what the situation is...he's calm," Watson stated.

370.title: Money does funny things, it may have poisoned my relationship with Clarke: Symonds
370.article_body: Opening up on the breakdown of his relationship with Michael Clarke, ex-Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds suggested that Clarke might have become jealous when he became the most expensive overseas player at the inaugural IPL auction. "Money does funny things. It’s a good thing, but it can be a poison and I reckon it may have poisoned our relationship," Symonds said.

371.title: Ola Electric recalls 1,441 electric 2-wheelers amid incidents of EVs catching fire
371.article_body: Ola Electric is recalling 1,441 units of its electric two-wheelers in the wake of incidents of vehicles catching fire. The company said its investigation into the fire incident on March 26 in Pune is ongoing. Recently, there have been several incidents of electric two-wheelers catching fire in various parts of the country forcing manufacturers to recall their vehicles.

372.title: 1 dead, many missing after boat carrying 60 capsizes off Lebanon
372.article_body: One girl was confirmed dead and several others went missing after a boat carrying 60 migrants capsized off the Lebanese coast, said authorities. Lebanon's Transportation Minister Ali Hamie said that 45 people have been rescued and the girl's body has been brought to the shore. The search for the remaining persons is underway, he added.

373.title: US woman falls into vault toilet while trying to get phone, rescued
373.article_body: A woman was rescued by firefighters after she fell into a vault toilet at a national park in US' Seattle while she was trying to retrieve her phone, which had also fallen in. The woman had disassembled the toilet and used dog leashes to get her phone, authorities said. A vault toilet has a tank underneath it to hold waste.

374.title: 2 class 9 students out for dip in cold water drown in Punjab canal
374.article_body: Two class 9 students, both aged 15, who had gone to take dip in cold water, drowned in a canal near Gurdwara Flahi Sahib on Ludhiana-Malerkotla road on Saturday. Police said the deceased, Vijay and Ayush, along with their friend Bhupinder, slipped into deep water after losing balance. While locals managed to rescue Bhupinder, Vijay and Ayush were swept away.

375.title: Explosives, detonator found near Chandigarh jail; bomb squad rushed to spot
375.article_body: An explosive device was found abandoned near the rear boundary wall of the high-security Burail jail in Chandigarh, following which police cordoned off the area and Indian Army's bomb disposal squad was rushed to the spot. Police found a small transparent box, a long codex wire, a small object believed to be a detonator and around 250 grams of explosives.

376.title: Told Alia to do Udta Punjab, director wasn't convinced she could do it: Shahid
376.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said that he had sent the script of 'Udta Punjab' to actress Alia Bhatt. "I told her that 'you should do this role' and the director was not convinced that she could do it because she has fair skin and she is city-ish kind of girl so he thought she's not right for the character," he added.

377.title: HC denies child custody to man accused of abetting wife's suicide
377.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has denied child custody to a father who is accused of abetting his wife's suicide. The bench observed that the crime would "emotionally devastate and destruct the growing years of the minor [and] will completely compromise her...mental growth". The man had claimed that his three-year-old daughter had been taken away illegally by her maternal grandparents.

378.title: KKR can't be dependent on Andre Russell all the time: Parthiv Patel
378.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel said KKR can't be dependent on Andre Russell to finish the games for them all the time. "It's going to be very difficult if you're depending on your number seven...even when you are chasing [157 runs]," added Parthiv. Russell got out in the final over when KKR needed 12 off 5 balls to win against GT.

379.title: COVID-19 was 3rd leading cause of death in US in 2021: CDC
379.article_body: COVID-19 was the third leading cause of death in US in 2021 for a second straight year, said the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The infection was responsible for approximately 4.6 lakh deaths in the country, which was about 60,000 higher than the previous year. The two leading causes of death were heart diseases and cancer.

380.title: Ranas’ arrest display of arrogance of power: Devendra Fadnavis
380.article_body: Following Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana's arrest on Saturday, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said that power has gone to the head of the state government. "The Ranas had come to Mumbai to recite Hanuman Chalisa. The state government’s act is a display of arrogance. It shows power has gone to its head," Fadnavis added.

381.title: Manipur media to boycott state govt, BJP news over unpaid ad dues
381.article_body: The media outlets in Manipur have decided to boycott news related to the state government and BJP unit over their respective unpaid advertisement dues from today, according to a joint statement by the state publishers and journalists' unions. Earlier, media outlets had threatened to boycott the state government, BJP unit and Congress unit if dues aren't paid by April 23.

382.title: Indian pharma should focus on global market: Mansukh Mandaviya
382.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said the pandemic taught India’s pharma industry to become self-reliant but there is a need to focus on innovations so that the sector grows and captures the global market. "We identified several Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients and started their manufacturing in the country. We now must look forward to be agile against the global competition," Mandaviya added.

383.title: Will reacted to his wife giving him the side-eye: Chris Rock's mother on Oscar slap
383.article_body: Speaking on Will Smith slapping her son Chris Rock at the Oscars, author Rose Rock said, "You reacted to your wife giving you the side-eye, and you went up, and you made her day because she was bowled over laughing when it happened." The incident happened when Chris Rock made a joke about Smith's wife Jada Pinkett Smith's shaved head.

384.title: My bungalow is very expensive, couldn't be built by doing 4-5 commercial films: Nawazuddin
384.article_body: On being asked whether working in commercial films helped him built his new bungalow 'Nawab', actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said, "My bungalow is very expensive. It couldn't have been built by just doing four-five commercial films." He further said, "There are some films I have done for free and I will continue to do this, if I believe in them."

385.title: Will be appropriate if Kejriwal uses decent language: Jairam Thakur
385.article_body: Chief Minister of Himachal Pradesh, Jairam Thakur, said that it will be appropriate if Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal uses "decent language" in the state. "Kejriwal came to Mandi [for first time]...and went back without saying much...People of Himachal are patient listeners...they don't react much," he said. "Jairam is taking...leaf from the AAP's book," Kejriwal had said.

386.title: He really slapped me: Chris Rock's mother on Will Smith slapping her son
386.article_body: Speaking on Will Smith slapping her son Chris Rock at Oscars, author Rose Rock said, "When Will slapped Chris, he slapped all of us, but he really slapped me. When you hurt my child, you hurt me." She added, "I feel really bad he never apologised. His people wrote up a piece...but something like that is personal. You reach out."

387.title: Was nervous, had a thousand questions: Yami on starting Hindi film career at 23
387.article_body: Yami Gautam, who began her journey in Hindi film industry at the age of 23, said, "When I came to...city, I was...nervous and had a thousand questions." The actress, however, added that despite venturing into an "unknown territory", she wasn't scared. "It all comes down to being yourself, being fearless about your choices, and just going for it," said Yami.

388.title: You made me cry like a baby: Ananya on Shahid's performance in 'Jersey'
388.article_body: Ananya Panday took to her Instagram Stories to share a post appreciating Shahid Kapoor's performance in his latest release 'Jersey'. "You made me cry like a baby!!! Just the best," she wrote. Ananya also tagged Mrunal Thakur and wrote, "You're sunshine girl." Directed by Gowtam Tinnanuri, it's a remake of Telugu film 'Jersey', which featured Nani in the lead role.

389.title: UP woman's head tonsured by husband, in-laws as she refuses to leave home
389.article_body: A 40-year-old woman's head was allegedly tonsured after she was physically assaulted by her husband and in-laws in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh. Her hands and legs were also allegedly tied and she was locked inside a room for two days. The incident allegedly took place when she refused to leave the house, which was constructed with financial assistance of her brother.

390.title: 3 RTO officials suspended after child died in Ghaziabad bus mishap
390.article_body: The UP government has suspended three RTO officials over negligence after a 10-year-old student hit his head on a pole while looking out of the school bus window and died in Ghaziabad's Modinagar. The government action comes after it was found that the bus was running without a fitness certificate and was blacklisted.

391.title: Gained invincible power: N Korea's media ahead of military holiday
391.article_body: North Korea's state media on Sunday claimed that the country has gained "invincible power that the world cannot ignore and no one can touch" under its leader Kim Jong-un. This comes ahead of the 90th anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army. Earlier this month, the country claimed that it had tested a new guided weapons system.

392.title: AAP claims Centre plans to demolish Delhi temple, holds protest
392.article_body: AAP on Saturday claimed that the BJP-run central government is planning to demolish Neelkanth Mahadev temple in Delhi's Sriniwaspuri and shared a purported notice by the Housing and Urban Affairs Ministry regarding the same. The party workers, including AAP MLA Atishi, also staged a protest there. "AAP won't allow bulldozers to run over a single temple in Delhi," Atishi said.

393.title: People say 'Don't you advise your son, tell him to do commercial films': Anil
393.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor said that it is difficult to make people understand when they ask him if he does not advise son Harsh Varrdhan and say he should tell Harsh to do more commercial films. "I say, 'He'll do...when he simply feels...he wants to do it...I don't want to tell him 'you do this...you do that, or anything'," Anil added.

394.title: India reports 2,593 new COVID-19 cases, 44 deaths in 24 hours
394.article_body: India has reported 2,593 COVID-19 cases, 1,755 recoveries and 44 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,527 COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 15,873, while the death toll rose to 5,22,193.

395.title: Want to pay for my brother's education & grandparents' medical bills: Palak
395.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak Tiwari said she wishes to help her mother with the family's expenses. "My mom has always been a sole earner, and I want to take that pressure off her back," she added. Palak said she wants to earn enough so that she can provide for her brother's education and pay for her grandparents' medical bills.

396.title: Delhi BJP to ask AAP govt to rename 40 villages
396.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Saturday said that the party would ask the Aam Aadmi Party-led government to change the names of 40 villages, which "are a symbol of slavery", in the national capital. The villages include Hauz Khas, Masoodpur, Zamrudpur, Humayunpur, Begumpur, Yusuf Sarai and Fatehpur Beri, according to BJP members.

397.title: Explosion heard in Jammu village hours ahead of PM Modi's visit to J&K
397.article_body: An explosion was purportedly heard on Sunday early morning in Jammu's Bishnah village, hours ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to Jammu and Kashmir. A senior police officer said a small crater was formed in agricultural fields following the explosion. Local villagers claimed the blast-like sound may have been caused either by lightning or a small meteorite-like object, he added.

398.title: We shouldn't have lost so many wickets in first 5 overs vs SRH: Du Plessis
398.article_body: Talking about their nine-wicket defeat against SRH, RCB captain Faf Du Plessis said they need to find a way to set the foundation while batting in the powerplay in their upcoming games. "The first [five] overs, we shouldn't have lost so many wickets...We just needed to get through that phase," he added. RCB lost four wickets in first five overs.

399.title: Which batters have hit the biggest sixes in IPL 2022 at halfway mark?
399.article_body: MI's 18-year-old batter Dewald Brevis has hit the biggest six of IPL 2022 so far, which has a distance of 112 metres. PBKS' Liam Livingstone hit the second-biggest six (108 metres) of IPL 2022 so far against CSK's Mukesh Choudhary. RR's Jos Buttler is on the third position with a 107-metre six against DC's Shardul Thakur.

400.title: Boria Majumdar found guilty of intimidating Saha, faces 2-year ban by BCCI: Report
400.article_body: Journalist Boria Majumdar has been found guilty by a three-member BCCI committee of intimidating wicketkeeper Wriddhiman Saha over an interview request, The Indian Express reported. BCCI is likely to impose a two-year ban on Boria and it will also write to ICC to blacklist the journalist. Majumdar had sent threatening texts to Saha, which were publicly shared by the latter.
